reviews.text: I normally am not a chain restaurant kind of lady, but you can never go wrong with CF. My boy loves coming here with me, he loves sitting in the two person booth. He loves the chicken fingers a lot! I had the salmon last time, i think the miso, and WOW! it was amazing. I always get great service here.

First and foremost, this place is Dark as hell inside. <br><br>Other than that, the service is pretty. Though their menu is always fairly overwhelming (because it had the drink menu, the lunch menu, the speciality menu, the brunch menu, the cheesecake menu ...), there are a few good selections. <br><br>Food: <br>During my visit, I had the Jambalaya Pasta. It was fairly good. I did request to have more sauce because the noodles were kind of dry. Once that was on the pasta, it was a game changer. <br><br>The brown bread is my favorite! Best while it&#39;s warm of course. <br><br>Drinks:<br>Drinks were pretty solid. I sat at the bar during this visit. It was on a Wednesday, so there was not too many people there. Bartender was friendly and. Accommodating. <br><br>Overall good experience. Definitely a lot to choose from.

Had a 12:45 reservation was a few mins late They Cancelled it. So we decided to make another reservation we knew the wait would be about and hour which was ok! I explained to the waitress about our earlier cancellation and we really only wanted Brunch. She talked to the manager and we were able to order off the brunch menu everything was flavorful hot an fresh!

Awesome place for dinner tonight and the choices for cheesecake are incredible! Had a great waiter-Austin-who took our orders quickly and brought out our drinks and bread quickly. Placed our order and it was off the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; part of menu but sandwich was fresh and good portion. Cheesecake was amazing, although I was only able to take 2 bites. Got take home container for cheesecake and salad. Place was clean with nice music and friendly staff. I&#39;d definitely recommend this place and only took off 1 star since most main dishes had onions in the description or sauce which I can&#39;t eat. More restaurants should have a non onion option for sauces etc. otherwise it would be 5/5.

Out of 5 Stars<br>Service: 5<br>Cleanliness: 4<br>Food: 4.5<br>Beer Selection: 1<br>Overall: 4<br>Comment: Stopped in on a Thursday evening and they weren&#39;t very busy. Asked for a table for two and was told it was a ten minute wait. No problem. However, when I looked a round there were literally dozens of tables empty. Why the wait? I let it go and we were called about 5 minutes later. Our waiter greeted us immediately. Austin was friendly and very helpful. Ordered drinks and they came in a few minutes. Food took about 15 which is about average and nothing to complain about. Had the Turkey and Avocado sandwich and it was excellent! A little small but it was one of the low calorie dishes so I kinda of expected that. Finally, I had the Adams Peanut Butter Cup cheesecake and incredible! Obviously they&#39;re known for cheesecake and for that they definitely didn&#39;t disappoint. Overall, a nice place and a good experience. I&#39;d return.
We had lunch at Cheesecake Factory in Towson and our experience was good.  The staff were all friendly, service was quick and the food was delicious.   I recommend this restaurant.

Kara (our waitress) was excellent! Food was delicious. Cheesecake factory gives you many options to choose from. If you&#39;re health conscious, they have food for dieters, vegans and low calorie options.

As I always say, I&#39;m not a big fan of chain restaurants but the Cheesecake Factory has always been an exception. Their food is always great, and this time was no different. Came here on Saturday 10.19.19 before heading to see Maleficent at Cinemark Towson. They don&#39;t do reservations or call ahead seating here, which is a bit of a gamble coming here on a Saturday so we decided to give ourselves plenty of time (or so we thought). Our movie started at 8:30 and we had reserved seats, so we weren&#39;t terribly worried about getting there exactly at 8:30. We arrived to the Cheesecake Factory around 6:30. I figured we&#39;d probably have a half hour to 45 minute wait, so I was assuming we&#39;d be sitting by 7:15 and hopefully done eating by 8:15. Well I was spot on with the 7:15 part but our server didn&#39;t come to greet us and take our drink order until almost 7:30. And he passed by our table several times beforehand. When he came to take our drink order, we were already ready to put in our food order since we were a little pressed for time; however, before we could say &#34;we are ready to order,&#34; he walked away to get our drinks. And he didn&#39;t come back with them (fountain drinks, not cocktails) for another 5 or so minutes. When he came back with the drinks we told him we were ready to order. We got stuffed mushrooms to share, and I got ribeye medium rare and my partner got a chicken Cesar salad. Our server went to get us bread and yet again was gone for 5-10 minutes. Our food didn&#39;t come until around 8:00 so we had to rush to eat. Unfortunately it wasn&#39;t our server who delivered the food so we had to wait to see him again to ask for the check while we were still eating, so we could just get out of there. When we finally saw him again, we asked for our check. He came back with it after another 5 minutes, I gave him a gift card to pay, and then when he came back with the receipt we asked for a box for the salad. Then a large party of maybe 10 got seated right next to us, and instead of getting our box he proceeds to immediately take their orders as soon as they sat down. We had to flag down a hostess for a box for our leftovers. <br><br>I get it, Saturday&#39;s are busy here and so we tried to plan accordingly. I don&#39;t think it&#39;s unreasonable to expect to not have to rush for an 8:30 movie when you get to the restaurant 2 hours before the movies start time. But we didn&#39;t end up leaving the Cheesecake Factory until around 8:25 after arriving at 6:30. For 2 people. Thank goodness for reserved seating at the movies. <br><br>I will say that my ribeye was one of the best I&#39;ve ever eaten and I tried my partner&#39;s chicken Cesar salad which was also delicious. The stuffed mushrooms were great too. 5 stars for food, 1 star for service.

I&#39;ve ate at Cheesecake Factory multiple times and at several locations.  This time we chose the Dulaney Valley Road location in Towson. 01/05/2020. Emma was our server and I must say she was amazing!!! Attentive but not constantly at the table. Gave refills before we asked. I ordered cheesecake to go and she had them put the whipped cream in a side container. I have never had anyone ever offer to do this and I always get a slice of cheesecake to go. She even gave us to go cups of our drinks without us asking. It&#39;s the little things that leave the best impression. <br>I will definitely ask for her to be my server the next time. Kudos to Emma!

I did not even eat here recently this review was based on just PHONE SERVICE. I wanted to get this coupon deal at the restaurant, and their website was not letting me order it at all. So I called and asked the server who answered for the deal and she was like I am not sure let me get my manager and I was like, thank you. When the manager Gigi got on the phone, not only did she interrupt me but she was rude. The deal ended and I was unaware but that was not the issue, she told me it was over many times over and over and did not recommend a solution or another deal she just keep repeating it was over and when I finally said oh ok, she just abruptly hung up the phone. I do not think I have ever had such rude phone service except from uber eats. I would rather go to the location in Inner Harbor and wait an hour than return here for that service.

I have severe Celiac Disease and they were able to accommodate me perfectly and even brought me out gluten free bread to eat when the &#34;regular&#34; bread was brought out (and it was delicious!!). Will definitely be returning!

After a long day decided to go to dinner with my friend after work. Arrived and the waiting area only had two parties. We requested a booth, and they said they it would be about 10 minutes to clean off a table. They gave us a pager and we said we would just be checking out the Cheesecake display. <br><br>After 10 minutes we went to the desk to get menus, so we would know what we wanted when we sat down. While standing at the check in desk we saw a woman approach and ask for a booth for two. The hostess responded sure we have one free now. They took her to the booth a few feet away. We then inquired about  our booth and they said it was ready. <br><br>We were walked over to a half table half booth. We reminded the hostess we wanted a full boith, she walked us back to the hostess stand and told the person there we needed a booth. They informed us it would be another 15 minutes. I spotted the manager and went over to express the concern about what transpired. He went over to discuss with the hostesses. They said they paid us, which was not true because it never went off nor did they verbally call us. The hostess got really snappy and walked by stating they were cleaning off table for us. <br><br>We finally were seated and our server John waa super nice and hospitable, such was a nice change. I would advise training all staff in customer service especially people on the front line dealing with guests. <br><br>The fish and chips were fresh and the batter was well seasoned. Not sure how soon I&#39;ll be returning to this location.

The worst of the worst.  I feel guilty even giving them 1 star - they don&#39;t even deserve that.  I called for carry out and after 10 minutes &#34;the bakery&#34; where you order didn&#39;t pick up, so I walked over.  After 20 minutes waiting for a salad I ordered it was clear that all I was going to get was the run around.  &#34;The manager will be right over.&#34;  He/she never came and I gave up and walked out.  4 people behind the front desk and NOBODY who could care less about service or telling the truth.
With multiple tables open, we were unable to be seated due to a lack of wait staff. 30 min wait. Explained we only wished a drink, nope they couldn&#39;t see their way around that one.

2 times in a week!<br><br>I was at Towson town center and my daughter wanted to come here.<br><br>Much better dining experience from the Downtown location last week.<br><br>Food:<br><br>Dynamite shrimp- deliciouso!! They are really great. They are fried to perfection and the spicy dipping sauce so good!<br><br>Fried chicken sliders - Good. Some of the chicken was smaller than other pieces. <br><br>Margarita- Great!<br><br>Service was good.

Worst experience ever <br>Food came out cold <br>Broccoli was reheated to the point of mush ....not eatable <br>I had spit the cold broccoli back on my plate and that was reheated and sent back to me <br>Barmaid knew I was unhappy and did nothing but give me the bill <br>40 dollars for half a filet and reheated spit out broccoli <br><br>I travel alot and stay in the Shetaton across the street ....I will never eat here again .<br><br>Oh and the manager that I requested at the hostess station was about as helpful as a filthy door knob.<br><br>Never again
I know that things have been difficult during the pandemic and I truly understand. However, I hope that the portions return to the original size after the economy begins to recover. God bless.

I went in for lunch on a weekday the service was good and not to rushed and not to slow I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta and added asparagus, this was my first time trying this dish and it was good I would order again , and had the red velvet cheesecake To go

Our waitress Salina gave me and my wife an outstanding service. Very polite and courteous!!!<br>Wife ordered the fish tacos and I ordered crispy pineapple chicken and shrimp which blew our minds, just amazing!!!

This was my first time here and besides the server being amazing nothing else was worth coming back<br><br>Pros: <br><br>awesome server <br><br>Cons: <br><br>*atmosphere ( it was freaken hot in there )<br>*The food sucked (sliders had next to no meat on them, the one slider had a sliver of meat that didn&#39;t even take up the little slider bun<br>*it was so loud you couldn&#39;t hear each other talking<br>*our friend got a expensive meal and it looks like a toddler threw it together.
SLOW waited 1 hr &amp; 30 min for one spaghetti and 2 cheesecakes. Never coming back to this location ever again

I love the Cheesecake Factory from the presentation of the restaurant to the wonderful food. Yes even though I love Cheesecake Factory this location has let me down twice. Since they don&#39;t offer reservations I have set up two parties at this location (meaning showed up 2 hours before the event) and they have always had an excuse when it&#39;s time for the area I waited for being available. So that&#39;s been a let down. The manager the second time comped some appetizers on the house but my guest were starving from the wait so many people were upset. <br><br>The food at this location is delicious! I have only experienced one issue before and it wasn&#39;t their fault. The service to get our food was average which was disappointing. The waitress we had wasn&#39;t the most personable person but we were all still nice with her. The appetizers came at a decent rate but our main entrees were all coming out at all different times. That was disappointing for the simple fact everyone was starving! Even though the food wasn&#39;t all on point one thing that truly was were the drinks! I ordered three and they were all pleasant! <br><br>Hopefully this location can get it together to get the 5 stars I know them to be!!

This location is one of my favorites! It&#39;s always busy that&#39;s the only reason i didn&#39;t give 5 I had to wait 2 hours before. I love that it&#39;s valet parking and parking lots because it&#39;s hooked to Towson town center. Happy hour at this location I from 4-6pm. Awesome items. Just like any other CF the menu has something for everyone. This location has outdoor seating also. They have the to-go parking in the garage near the valet. The bathrooms are always clean. Customer service is awesome.

Cheesecake factory never disappoints in my book. I had the bacon bacon cheeseburger, wife had pizza and a salad and daughter had a pasta meal. Along with calamari for an appetizer. Everyone enjoyed the meals and as usual the cheese cakes and carrot cake to take home. The wait here is a little longer than usual which means it took a while for the food to come out but our server Sarah C. was great and that makes up for the wait. Once again cheese cake factory wins our heart!!!

I can&#39;t say I&#39;ve had a ton of food from Cheesecake Factory.  But the nachos are amazing.  The chips are thick pita like and super good.  The nachos are loaded with everything nachos should have and the cheese is amazing!  The cheesecake also is a go to and delicious.  My favorite is the Oreo cheesecake!!  On the healthier side of things, the Mexican tortilla salad from The Skinnylicous menu is really good.  Menu is very extensive and has everything you could possibly want.  Out of the things I&#39;ve ordered, I&#39;ve never had anything I really disliked.  This place is usually busy and pricier.

These folks just can&#39;t get it right. Just went there last week and had a great dine in experience. Back today and there&#39;s NO dine in and the to go inside order experience was the horrific!! The online special was totally out. There&#39;s only one person taking in person and phone orders. You have to stand back in line again when your order is ready   worse part today got all the way home and the order was wrong. No peas in the pasta as requested no salad as requested but fries instead. Uuugghh too much money time and inconvenience. Gave two stars since the mac n cheese burger was cooked perfectly. Won&#39;t be returning until things turn back to normal. Whatever that is ....

I wish I had more time to take pictures while I was at this restaurant, but honestly... what&#39;s most important is I went on a Saturday night, probably 8pm. Of course, everyone&#39;s dinner hour. My cousin and I were planning to walk in and upon meeting the host, we were informed that the wait was 1.5-2hours. At that time, I made reservations with The Cheesecake Factory on this Yelp app and was seated, with my drink within 45 minutes. Please take advantage if you have the ability as I had to share my (first) great experience!

Food is always pretty good with a wide variety of options for everyone. Portion sizes and cheesecake slices are pretty big and filling for the prices. This specific location has had VERY slow service the past 2 times I&#39;ve been here (Mon 5p and Sun 7p), so I won&#39;t be back here for a while.

Been here twice so far and each time the food is great comes out at the reasonable time. Can&#39;t tell you how much I love that. The part I dislike truly is the no reservations. I on some part understand it. But still. But the low lights gives it an amazing feel the decor if you ever look up its different but it does go along with that. I got the penne four cheese and it was worth it. I will be back to this location again.

This place is usually hit or miss from my experiences. Today was a hit!!! I had the day off and decided to take myself on a date. I sat at the bar, and from the moment I sat down the bartender (Will) was very attentive! I&#39;d never been here for lunch, so he gave an honest explanation about the lunch portions. I decided to have the lunch version of the meatloaf which was cooked to perfection. While dining, Will maintained the perfect balance of making sure that all was well, having general bartender-customer conversation, and giving me space. <br><br>Overall, my visit was phenomenal. If you have yet to do so, pay this location a visit. If you&#39;re sitting at the bar, ask for Will!!

This is located in the Towson Town Center which is easy to get to from Route 695, they have an attached parking garage which makes it nice for inclement weather.<br><br>We have been here several times and always enjoy it.<br><br>We got seated immediately as it was right around 12:30 on Sunday.  Within a minute we were greeted by our server who was simply outstanding and extremely attentive and friendly !  Could not have had better service .....<br><br>We ordered the assorted egg rolls appetizer and it was hot and full of flavor.  The normal bread basket and butter was perfect as usual.<br><br>Our meals came to our table hot and well presented.  <br><br>My wife loved her meal, the name eludes me but it was outstanding !<br><br>I ordered the Chicken Madeira, sorry if mis-spelled.  The dinner looked great, had great flavor and so forth until I started cutting into the 2nd chicken which was RAW.  The server immediately got the manager who apologized and offered to make it again, I kindly declined and they removed it .... was not to thrilled as I could have eaten the other chicken which could have been just as raw ?<br><br>Whom ever cooked this needs to be a little more aware !<br><br>Naturally we had to get their killer cheesecake to go ...<br><br>We can&#39;t complain for the most part, under cooked food happens .... but this should not happen !<br><br>We will be back ...... but I&#39;ll change my selection !<br><br>Service was flawless - 5 Stars !  My wife&#39;s dinner was 5-Star .... <br><br>I had to rate this visit 4 stars due to undercooked chicken.

Worst Cheesecake Factory EVER! <br><br>Usually this is my go to restaurant for some good food and low key night, but this experience was horrible. <br><br>First of all, the table was disgusting.. dirty cups let there and straws. The small plates and utensils were unwashed!!! Disgusting. <br><br>Then when we ordered, 2 of our plates were incorrect and we let it go both times bc mistakes happen. On top of that, the server charged us for both plates... so I was charged for 2 messed up plates and the 2 actual plates even if I had ordered it originally and they eased up my order!!!!! <br><br>Then we ordered cheesecake to go and came home to 2 plain cheesecakes instead of what we actually ordered and paid for! <br><br>We let that go to, but then my sisters both got food poisoning from eating here. They both had the lasagna and a burger and both got sick. <br><br>I called and the manager said sorry. Really? <br><br>This place is a mess and do yourself a favor, please don&#39;t go here and risk your health.

I had a 6 PM reservation for 2. We were a little early to our reservation and were sat shortly after arriving. Out server Sam was the best and gave great service. The food was delicious. We had complimentary bread, pretzel bites with fondue cheese as an appetizer, I got the mac and cheese burger and my boyfriend had the shrimp and chicken gumbo. For dessert I had tiramisu cheesecake and he had the original cheesecake with strawberries. Great food and great service. Will definitely be back.
Terrible service.  Sat waiting for entree about an hour and then was told it was not ready after they finally served the other 2 members of my dinner party.  Never again.

I&#39;d like to start by saying my boyfriend and I&#39;s experience last night at the Cheesecake Factory was one of the absolute best we&#39;ve had at the restaurant. Our waitress Emma was pleasant and accommodating from the time we sat down til the time we left. If we could request her services again, we&#39;d do so with no hesitation. Great service compliments the dining experience!!! Now, on to the food. We started with drinks. I enjoyed a Peach Bellini while my boyfriend enjoyed the Georgia Peach. Both drinks were frozen cocktails and refreshing. Then we enjoyed the cheeseburger spring rolls appetizer which were absolutely delicious! By the time we thought to take a picture for this review, we were finished! Our entrees are attached. Truffle Honey Chicken w/ mashed potatoes and Louisiana Chicken Pasta w/ a slightly spicy sauce. So darn yummy!!! Succulent chicken breast, flavorful, fresh! Very very pleased with both dishes. Healthy portions which allowed for to go boxes. And of course, we couldn&#39;t leave without getting dessert. So full from dinner, we opted to take our desserts to go. One cheesecake slice w/ fresh strawberries and one slice of the blackout cake (chocolate w/ chocolate chips &amp; almonds). Wea wonderful date night.

I understand there&#39;s reservations. But when we walked in the host said 45 mins wait. it&#39;s going on 1 hour and a few minutes now. I understand covid. But we expected to be seat by then or a few minutes after.

Came in Friday night for dessert after eating at Stoney River. The carry out counter was crowded but we had patience and decided to wait. 15 mins went by before we were next to order and the girl at the counter was on the phone w what  seemed to be a carry out order, no problem. As I&#39;m observing the chaos behind the counter I noticed the girl that was making the orders was not wearing gloves when others were. <br><br>She continued to make the orders, adjusting or touching the actual food on the plates to place it or move it around. Then, best of all she kept touching her face and wiping her nose then continuing to make the orders. NO THANKS. <br><br>Look, I get &#34;if you only knew what happened in restaurants etc..&#34; but, if you have your employees making the food in a well populated customer waiting area, you should probably make sure your following health code and guidelines. Gross.

Service was HORRIBLE!!!! It took 30 minutes after we were seated to get waters and menus!!!! We ordered a round of shots and the waitress rudely sat them down and didn&#39;t explain which ones were which! She stated she didn&#39;t remember and walked away! It took us then over 30 minutes to get someone to take our order! The manager was very nonchalant about the situation! It took then 40 minutes to get our food. No one checked on us or refilled any of our drinks! Piss poor service! The white bartender refereed to one of my friends as &#34;bruh&#34; and the manager didn&#39;t care! Don&#39;t waste your money!!!! I will never spend another cent here!!!!

Fantastic visit, great customer service, slightly above average food. Visited this location w a large party after goddaughters graduation.<br>We were given Abby &amp; Kia to take our orders, etc.  They were extremely professional, nice and 100% accuracy w orders. <br>The appetizers came out at a good pace but the entrees dragged a little as far as reaching the table and there were major complaints about a few food items. Mainly the blandness of a few items and  $1 - $3 upcharge on other sides offered. <br>I must admit, I was a little shocked about the complaints ... Until I tasted my food.<br>Collectively we ordered Nashville hot chicken nuggets, Lunch salmon fresh grilled salmon, Bacon bacon cheeseburger, Lunch fettuccini Alfredo w shrimp, Lunch soup, salad, and Chicken salad sandwich. Also, Calamari &amp;<br>Angel shrimp pasta.<br>Everything came to the table plated well.

I do enjoy cheesecake factory and the menu options that they have.  Our daughter had a pasta dish, my wife had some of their nachos. and I had a chicken quesadilla.  We all enjoyed the food.  <br>Our server was a nice young man, whom was attentive, when he was able to come to our table.  The food took quite a while to get to our table, and there was no apology about the delay nor was a reason given.  I get that the chain is widely popular and can be busy, but this was not acceptable.

Went for lunch on labor day. No wait to be seated. The waitress was nice and patient. The servings are always large. I wish they had a separate vegetarian menu. Looked like gluten free items were marked but not vegetarian.

Visited The Cheesecake factory yesterday for my daughters birthday dinner. The food was as expected, no disappointments. I realize that the prices on the menu aren&#39;t cheap, but to charge for a birthday cheesecake is a bit ridiculous. I&#39;m surprised I wasn&#39;t charged for the happy birthday song...

This place is always great.  I don&#39;t come here too often because the prices are pretty high.  We went last night and everything was fantastic.  Nicholas was our waiter and he was great.  The wait for our entrees was a little longer than expected, but other than that all was good.

Had an awesome experience here with our large group. We showed up with 20 to celebrate a graduation. The hostess told us it would be a while-- understandable with such a big group--but updated us regularly on timing. <br><br>We shared several apps including spinach dip, thai wraps, and the buffalo blasts. They were delicious! The waiter kept the bread refill coming and handled the drink refills well too.<br><br>Entrees were amazing, especially the chicken marsala and salmon with herbs. <br><br>We split the bill without any issues and took home some cheesecake slices for dessert. I&#39;ve been to several locations but found this one to be so clean, and very communicative about food, waits, etc. Would definitely recommend.

I really love this place and it&#39;s one of my favorite restaurants because of the fresh grilled salmon dish I get every time I come and the complimentary bread that is second to none (I order ALL wheat bread)! The mediocre rating is because their only specialty is the cheesecake, so their menu covers a wide range of food styles (Italian, asian cuisine, seafood) with no exact specialty. With this, most of their food items are just okay and you&#39;d be better off going to an Italian restaurant for pasta, etc. The amount of chicken they put in their pasta dishes and salads is simply deplorable and not worth the money. On the upside, you will definitely go and find at least one dish you love and that will be your favorite. I definitely recommend this place if you stay away from certain dishes.

Our experience was beyond subpar. I wish that the servers amazing service was enough to give more stars, unfortunately the Manager at this location bumped this rating from a possible 4 star review to a complete 2. I accidentally ordered the wrong dish, I mistakenly ordered the Cajun Jambalaya pasta, I wanted the Gumbo. I let our server know, and she completely understood and exclaimed that she had to wait for the manager to take the dish. When her manager came over he was incredibly condescending, stating &#34;you don&#39;t know the difference between pasta and rice!!!!&#34; Very rude. I explained to him that it was an easy mistake and I didn&#39;t want the meal, I didn&#39;t touch the food, I just want what I meant to order. He continued being rude before he inevitably took the plate. ALL HE HAD TO DO WAS TAKE THE PLATE, I wasn&#39;t being rude, I explain my position politely. <br><br>Also, we ordered 2 separate alcoholic beverages and they were basically diluted Juicy Juice. <br><br>The manager, was a tall heavyset Caucasian male with glasses. Crude and condescending, his attitude is everything you&#39;re not supposed to represent in the hospitality industry.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! They do not take reservations, so if you plan on coming during a busy time, be prepared to wait a little bit. They give you a buzzer and the waiting area is large! I&#39;ve been to this location many times, and overall the service is great. There were times it took a while for the food to come out, but it was busy and the kitchen was probably backed up! The managers were very kind and offered us complimentary cheesecake! My favorite meal here is the chicken and avocado sandwich! The bread is buttered and their is always so much chicken, bacon and avocado on the sandwich. The Cheesecake Factory does not skimp! With such a wide variety of options, there is certainly something for everyone!

Can&#39;t give them a 1 because the waitress tried starting it off the bathroom is horrible. Got our bread it was cold then the food my order came out wrong my nephew asked three people including the manager for ranch and everyone forgot my order the noodles taste like paste and were stuck together this is not the cheesecake standard that it&#39;s suppose to be terrible disappointment.

I&#39;ve been to this location a few times, the service is usually pretty below average and the food is just not that good. TCF used to have a higher quality and you just knew when you were going to eat there that you would be having a good time. The past few times I&#39;ve been to this location, the servers has treated me pretty poorly except the 1 time I was with my parents. It&#39;s obvious they know who has the money and they can be willing to do anything to get that extra tip. I would say come here if you&#39;re not a student/ have someone older with you. Then you&#39;ll get the service you want!
We picked up some cheesecakes to go and the server was considerate enough to let us know that a certain flavour was still frozen and needed to wait to thaw.

I ordered Shepard&#39;s pie as you can see in the picture. The worst Shepard&#39;s pie ever. Felt like I&#39;m eating a pile of grease. Very disappointing as this is a staple for Cheesecake Factory. Do not order here again ever.  The quality has drastically gone down. I will never eat here again. No coronary for me<br><br>On a lighter note. I spoke to the manager  about my food. He was very gracious and apologized for the food and allowed me to order something else. I ordered an spinach, bacon omelette with toast instead.... the omelette was very good and I was happy. I appreciate the professionalism and the prompt action by the manager. Because of him we stayed and our experience was remediated. Thank you Mr. Manager.

Ive been to cheesecake Factory so many times and it never fails me. The portions are beyond generous. The atmosphere is nice. I went during shift change and I must say the servers did a good job transitioning. The new server picked up where the other server left off smoothly. The service was amazing. And lets not forget about the cheesecake!!!!

always super crowded and loud, rude hostesses.  run by children, basically.  ordered cheesecake online for curbside pickup, called 3 times in the 30 minutes that i sat and waited while the employees came outside and cussed and smoked by the dumpsters, while i had 3 kids in the car with me.  was told 3 times the cheesecake would be right out, never came, left, canceled order.  manager called the next day, apologized, said charge would be credited, gift card was in the mail.  neither has happened, it has been 14 business days, and i am not calling again.  will just dispute with credit card company.  won&#39;t waste my time dealing with this crap again.  the cheesecake is delicious but not worth all of that

Bunch here is great. That&#39;s really all I eat from here other than the amazing cheesecake. This location is great and very popular, as it is always crowded. Sometimes, the wait can be pretty ridiculous. Service is pretty good. There have been a couple of times that I have had to send food back, which was disappointing. But, each time, the issue was corrected.

I&#39;ve been dining at the Cheesecake Factory for many years and I have noticed a consistent decline in both the quality of the food and the service. I dined at the Towson location earlier this week and the food was almost inedible. I sat at the bar and it took over 45 minutes to produce a burnt omelette accompanied by charred toast (without jam or butter) and room temperature potatoes. I requested siracha sauce which took another 10 minutes to arrive. I ordered bread upon arriving and I was told that they were out and that more would be coming shortly (this has happened each and every time I have eaten at this location in the last four years). The rolls did not arrive until I finished my meal. The man next to me at the bar made a remark that he didn&#39;t even eat a portion of his dinner because he was waiting on dinner rolls. How long does it take to toss frozen bread in an oven? The menus were also incredibly sticky and I&#39;m not convinced that they were being properly wiped down. The sanitation effort seemed minimal in light of COVID. It&#39;s not worth the frustration, the price or the potential health hazard.

We had the PERFECT dining experience here last night! Only had to wait 15 minutes for our table, excellent service and all three of us loved the food we ordered. <br><br>I had the grilled pork chop with yummy mashed potatoes and sautéed green beans--delectable! A spoonful of homemade applesauce made it even better. My sister was in the middle of a cleanse and was able to find several salads that fit the bill. The restaurant&#39;s iconic &#34;book menu&#34; now includes many more healthy salad options that included several &#34;super foods&#34;--Brussels sprouts, quinoa, kale, sunflower seeds, arugula , roasted beets and lots more. She added steak to her salad but there were a few other options (almond crusted salmon!) and enjoyed every bite.<br><br>Our friend decided on a stir fried shrimp and chicken entree served in a sweet pineapple sauce over rice...she couldn&#39;t even finish the large serving and was able to take half of it home for another meal. We decided against dessert, even though we were tempted...1500 calories for a single slice of their cheesecake was just too outrageous! <br><br>Try the &#34;new and improved&#34; Cheesecake Factory. Your taste buds will thank you!

I like the cheesecake factory, but I love the fact it was a first date location.   This visit I got a burger, because apparently all turkey in the place was not being served....no reason given, but I am guessing a recall.  The menu here, is expansive.....no....it is a BOOK.   There is something for EVERYONE.<br>  The burger I had was medium rare, and it was perfectly cooked.    My love had a veggie burger, and she enjoyed it as well.   One thing was troublesome...    The first person who was our server was great.    Then there was shift change and no warning..... we had a new server.   The second server was ok, but it is good customer service to inform the customer , instead of doing the &#34;server switch&#34;, lol.

Today&#39;s bartender, who shall remain nameless was sarcastic and looked at me like I was crazy when I made a reasonable special request on our most recent visit 07-02-17 at 10am. I requested that my eggs be cooked hard/well done, like I do EVERY time. We are regular customers, so I know exactly what I want and how I want it. He stated &#34;the consistency of eggs won&#39;t get hard.&#34;  What eggs does he eat? Bill Nye the Egg Guy. Annoying! He poured a very weak Typhoon for $11.50 and failed to order my potatoes. They were not served with my entrée. We will return, but if he&#39;s bartending, we&#39;ll sit elsewhere.<br>*Four stars for the food and not the last dining experience.

Normally Cheesecake Factory is my last minute go-to chain restaurant for family night, because the food and service are good. I&#39;m giving two stars based on my recent experience ordering a cheesecake 4 hours prior to our scheduled pickup time. Our cake was still frozen completely. The manager working that evening was rude and unprofessional to say the least. After that experience I will not be returning to the Towson location.

We dined on a Thursday afternoon. We were seated in the bar area. There were people seated at five of the other tables. We waited about 5-minutes before our server showed up and introduced herself, Jessye.<br>Jessye was polite but a little soft spoken. <br>We ordered water and the Thai Lettuce Wraps for our appetizer. Of course we were given our water right away.  It was a bit before our wraps arrived. <br>Our server appeared to have vanished and it was a good ten minutes before she came back and took our entree order. We ordered Chicken Chipotle Pasta and the Veggie Burger. <br>The wraps came with three different sauces. All 3 were tasty and the wraps were delicious. <br>The Veggie Burger tasted bland but had nice consistency and great toppings, red onions, avocado, cucumbers cheese and lettuce. <br>I thought the chicken had good flavor but was a bit over cooked. <br>In typical CCF fashion our meal was filling. Sorry we didn&#39;t have the capacity for cheesecake. <br>Overall it was a decent dining experience. We would dine there again.

I never have a bad experience here.  Despite the restaurant being corporate, they strive to train their employees to make each guest feel well taken care of like a regular customer.<br><br>I recently went to the mall to exchange some make up at the Sephora.  I was starving and decided to sit at the bar for a quick bite to eat and a drink (or two).<br><br>Joe C. took care of me and did a wonderful job.  He makes a mean margarita, and provided a nice, light, lunchtime banter with me as I sat and enjoyed my lunch.<br><br>I ordered a glass of rose, a margarita, the Tex mex egg rolls, the Caesar salad, fried mac and cheese balls (to go), and fried chicken sliders (to go).<br><br>Everyone from the food runners to the bussers were efficient, pleasant, and great.  I would go back next time I am at the Towson Town Center for sure.

I have to preface this with the fact that I did not dine in here.  I really only wanted a piece of cheesecake.  With that being said, I was on a mission and right before I left here I thought I would stop in quickly and be on my way.  That turned out to be a fiasco.<br><br>I walked in and walked right up to the cheesecake counter and looked at the cheesecake menu.  (Man, that&#39;s too many cheesecakes in one sentence) After looking at the menu I had to wait several minutes to be noticed standing there.  Once I was noticed, I was ignored.  Finally I was asked what I wanted and then told it would be several minutes to get it because of the orders from the people dining in.  <br><br>When I did finally get my order I was happy to finally pay and get out of there.  If looks could have killed in here, I probably wouldn&#39;t have been walking out.  The person cutting and serving the cheesecake did not look like she was in a happy place.  In fact it looked as if she was in her own personal hell.

My doctor told me to ingest gluten as part of a gluten challenge so yup! I was in there all too excited to eat the &#34;chocolate&#34; bread according to doctors orders. I did and totally broke out but that&#39;s ok. That chocolates bread is divine. Drinks are always great. Had the tuna tartar which could&#39;ve been a little better but I think that&#39;s because I&#39;m used to how they made it in NY. Either way a good clean spot that gives you the quality and service that the CF is known for.

I ordered a Cobb salad that wasn&#39;t satisfying at all. No eggs and bad greens with it which was lettuce instead of mix greens like the menu express. The waiter never mentioned they were out of ingredients to give me option to change my order. And also my cheesecake whip cream was very watery and not flavorful like in the past. Customer service was poorly as well. I will never come back to this location again for lunch. Very disappointed

Every time I come to Cheesecake I always get the Louisiana Chicken Pasta because it&#39;s SO GOOD! It has bowtie pasta, peppers, onions, mushrooms in a creamy sauce, with fried chicken on top. It also has a spice sprinkled on top that reminds me of old bay. The portions are huge, and they have lunch prices available until 5 PM! I always have leftovers that I need to box up and save for the next day. My only complaint about the pasta is that whenever I reheat it, there&#39;s always TONS of oil. Other than that, the pasta is always fantastic. I have noticed that the chicken portions have gotten smaller, which is unfortunate, but I will continue ordering this pasta dish because I love it so much!

Every time I come to this Cheesecake Factory, the wait is an hour or longer. This is ridiculous. I love Cheesecake Factory but I will not be coming to this one again.  People come in after us and get seated. Management and hostesses are rude.

This was a very disappointing experience.  Monday night, restaurant not crowded.  We waited for a long time for our entries.  I ordered the angel hair pasta with shrimp.  It tasted like it had been seating under the hot light for a good while.  This particular entree is $19.95 and it was not worth the price.  Do not recommend this place.

Good food, sloppy service. On my most recent visit, here is the order the food came out:<br>1) entrees<br>2) bread<br>3) soup<br>4) butter for the bread<br>5) appetizer<br><br>The waiter kept apologizing, but never worked her way out of the fluster, and things kept going wrong. Way too many things on the table; didn&#39;t get to eat the appetizer until last because I couldn&#39;t maneuver over my huge entree salad. <br><br>Also, the bus boy who kept cleaning the adjacent tables had a massive quantity of cologne on, which severely decreased the already limited enjoyment I was getting from my awkward meal. The waiter also took our check away before we had even paid, which made things even more awk. The food was good as usual, but the service was a big mess. Also, there was a super annoying loud talker sitting next to me and reading every menu item and description out loud, but I guess that&#39;s not their fault.

Its probably called the cheese cake factory for a reason. I had pancakes chicken and waffles and scrambled eggs with hollandaise sauce. It was ok didn&#39;t really leave a big impression in the tastebuds but I do like to be fair and try this place a couple more times to really have a just opinion about it. This experience I had here this time was mediocre at best. They did take a while to bring the food out and the syrup made my mouths dry. Idk it could have been me very I&#39;m thinking having brunch here isn&#39;t he best idea to go with.

I&#39;ve only been here twice now and my very first experience was amazing! Everything that I ordered tasted delicious . I ordered their strawberry lemonade, Korean fried cauliflower, fish and chips, I used sweet potato cut fries instead. Everything tasted fantastic and this is definitely a go to spot.<br><br>Their prices are reasonable. For four people we paid $90. But the service &amp; quality was great.

Two of us went to catch up. I ordered the skinnylicious lemon garlic shrimp. Its was the perfect portion given the fact that i was still going to order cheesecake. I wanted pasta but the pasta portions are enough for 3 meals. The entree was yummy! It had nice size shrimp linguine pasta and asparagus. Afterwards i ordered my favorite - the tiramisu cheesecake - delicious as always! <br><br>The waitresses changed shifts midway but they were both great!!!

This particular trip to Cheesecake Factory was interesting. I tried the the honey truffle chicken and I was unimpressed. The flavor was pretty bland. I sent it back. I ordered the Crispy Chicken Pineapple and Shrimp. That was delicious. The others in my group sent their food back as well. We had an issue getting things brought to the table and having items cleared. One thing that was a little different was the drink refills. The server informed us that she doesn&#39;t change the glasses because it&#39;s a lot of work for the bartender. I&#39;d never heard that before. Overall it wasn&#39;t the best experience but it wasn&#39;t the worst.

I don&#39;t really know how to review this location because I come here so much, and sometimes it&#39;s great while other times it is dreadful... So I&#39;m gonna meet them half way with a 3 star review...<br><br>First of all, I absolutely love their happy hour menu items! All apps are five dollars and selected drinks are five dollars as well! I love to go with my boyfriend have a couple margaritas and nachos and just relax. <br><br>The service is definitely hit or miss! You can tell they no longer really hold their staff to the high service qualities they once did! You once would get a nice greet from the server who would break down things for you. Now you get more of a what&#39;s up welcome to cheesecake what do you want to drink? That&#39;s really sad because their service is one thing about the company I always loved! I&#39;m here about 3-4 times a month and 3-4 times a month I get different service.... <br><br>The bartenders.... There is only one I have encountered named Aja who is amazing, bubbly and friendly! If I see her at the bar I most definitely will sit there. Aside from her the other bartenders I have had are a bit dry and non personable....so I don&#39;t sit there unless Aja is working.<br><br>The servers- man have they changed... Bare minimum service, not as friendly and social and knowledgable as they once were... I came across one I really liked and I will request him from now on...<br><br>The management.... Oh the management.... Very sad from the beginning days of when they opened.... These managers look underdressed, disheveled and not very personable. One lady dropped my food off, she clearly was a manager. She just dropped food off and left!!!! I mean what a perfect opportunity to indulge the guest when you drop food off to them! All you have to do is smile and say hello and ask how everything is? Ask what brought us in... I mean something.... We received non of that.... But hey if the owners are ok with the store managers operating like that, who am I to say anything...<br><br>The drinks, I love my margarita I get there... Aside from that I only order wine from their bar. The bartenders are trained to count liquor and never over pour or hook a drink up.... So what you get is a 1.25 ounce pour in your mixed drink... For those of you who don&#39;t know ounces it&#39;s not even enough to really taste in a vodka and cranberry for example.... Their drinks are rediculously OVER priced for the little amount of alcohol they do pour! So I recommend beer and wine unless it&#39;s happy hour... Then I would order some of their mixed drinks just to try....<br><br>The dessert, I have nothing bad to say their desserts are on point!!!!!!! However the bakery where you order Togo cheesecake, those attendants are not friendly, polite, or moderately personable! They are some of the most cold shouldered employees I have ever met. Hence why I do not order from them very often. I normally just order through my server or bartender.... <br><br>I do really enjoy their food and desserts and drinks. I just don&#39;t always enjoy my service... I wish they would go back to their old ways and teach these servers what being a waiter is all about....

6/1/18 while visiting from out of town my young server help me pick the perfect lunch. She was very polite and patient due to the fact I was unsure what I wanted for lunch that day. Atmosphere was very quiet and facility was very clean. The cheesecake is still the highlight of my meal and will remain my favorite part of coming to the restaurant!
Why even go to this place that they call a restaurant. The food is horrible and the service is even worse all the way from management down to the porter.

If I could a zero stars I would. The manager Brian complete and utter a-hole. My family and I came to resturaunt with a party of 20 to celebrate my nephew&#39;s send off to college. The resturaunt was notified the day prior and reminded the day of the arrival of the party at 7:00pm. Brian who is anything but helpful was extremely rude and seemingly did not want to even attempt to accommodate seating the party. He brushed my nephew off by telling him that it would be a 2 1/2 hour wait without even scanning the restaurant to see if there was any way we could be seated sooner. Thankfully for the resturaunt chain they hire hostesses with GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE, DECENCY, and CLASS because ERICA went abound and beyond to assist us after witnessing her manager with a complete DISMISSAL of our party. I&#39;m not sure if it is a racial issue that this man had or if he was having a bad day but either way this piece of  of a manger can learn a lot from Erica proper display of customer service. Brian is a disgrace to the Cheesecake Factory brand and is clearly DISCRIMINATORY in how he treats customers patronizing this establishment. I would NOT recommend coming here if you aren&#39;t the same race as Brian because he will hand you his a** to kiss

Vegetarian review: I usually get the Evelyn Pasta if I come here. Very simple dish with simple garlic and oil sauce  (dairy free). My last visit I ordered the Impossible burger, new item on the menu. So it totally tastes like meat. The cut was a little too thick for me. Not bad though. Im not sure about the bun but the special sauce contains mayo. Just FYI if you&#39;re vegan. The Asian cauliflower bites were good but a little sweet. The vegan cobb salad was just ok.

Ok so I get that you were busted for serving under age people, but refusing to serve alcohol for a government issued vertical ID is just plain rude. The manger on duty was a jerk about it too and unapologetic. It was a valid US license that everyone accepts except Cheesecake Factory apparently.

Cheesecake Factory is hands down 5 stars and this location is great! The servers are super good and it&#39;s big, roomy and has great food always. Sometimes the dishes are a little different every time you order. Also there is a obscene curfew for teenagers. There is a bar area and they do a good job of keeping tables private within the large space. Yummy yummy food of course and great for big group!!!

yesterday i went to the cheesecake factory to enjoy the company of my friends and some delicious food. sadly, my last expectation was not met. Upon entering the restaurant I had hoped to be assisted by one of this establishment&#39;s lovely waiters/waitresses. Unfortunately, my friends and I had to wait and especially long time to do so. We had to wait SO long to the point where we took recreation in counting exactly how many minutes would pass before we were assisted. I wish I could tell you about how exactly long we had to wait but I lost count after 40 minutes. Upon being visited by the waitress we gave our orders and we were told that in the meantime while we waited for our drinks and entrees to be prepared; we would be given the restaurant&#39;s supplemental bread dish to enjoy before our food was ready. Well, as soon as we got the bread we were met with the absolute displeasure of finding a thick disgusting, repulsive wad of pre-chewed gum on our bread. Of course we were not made aware of the fact that the bread was going to come with pre chewed bread and inquired whether or not we would have to pay extra for the additional gum piece. We were not given an explanation. But seeing as we were famished and how nowhere else to go we decided to abstain from consuming the bread and hoped that there would not be anymore surprise additional gum pieces emerging on any of our food. I have included below a picture of the gum which appeared on our bread for your viewing pleasure. Overall, our time here has been a horrible experience and though we decided to ignore the shortcomings of this venture. We will not be returning to this establishment. This might be by far the worst dining experience at a Chesapeake Cheesecake Factory franchise that I will ever have the dissatisfaction of experiencing. The only reason that this establishment is even receiving one star is because every meal for the rest of my life will now be better by comparison. If in the Maryland area, stay away from this place! Sincerely, a law student who doesn&#39;t like being screwed over by bratty corporations and waitresses.

Choose another place to eat...... We had reservations for 7 PM and waited two hours to be seated and after two (2) hours of excuses from the wait-staff and management, we left the restaurant.<br><br> We will never go there again and we will tell everyone we know about this experience.
Don&#39;t do pickup option! I order food that was suppose to be ready 10:11, it took 30 more minutes. When my fiance went to pick it up they ignored him. Bad service.
Great food! Located next to Sheraton where I am staying and has the nicest stores in the mall: LV, Burberry, Tiffany, Cartier etc. staff is very nice as well. Always love cheesecake decor

I ordered a carry-out meal on Feb. 13. Arrived at restaurant. They had a power outage, so my order could not be made, obviously.<br><br>Was willing to wait for refund. Manager assured me he would clear out the charge when the computers booted up so I wouldn&#39;t have to wait. <br><br>So I left. Problem being, they never removed the charge for my meal on card.<br><br>Called one week later. Talked to the business manager after being left on hold for 10 minutes. She couldn&#39;t help me.<br><br>So I&#39;m still being charged for food I did not receive. They couldn&#39;t control the power outage. But they could control charging a customer for food they could not prepare.

I am sad to say I was disappointed in the service. While our waiter was great the kitchen was extremely slow. I ordered a chicken parmesan sandwich but for some reason it came out drenched in some sort of pesto basil oil. The menu only said it came with marinara sauce on it. I was informed it was a recent change to the preparation but why isn&#39;t that listed on the menu as such or why wasn&#39;t I told? It then took the kitchen about 17 minutes to get a newly made sandwich out as my family was already done eating when it did. The server was kind about the situation but ultimately it boils down to the kitchen, when a mistake is made it should be top priority of the kitchen to remake the meal. Then it took about 15 minutes for a piece of cheesecake to get to us after we ordered it when we were all ready to leave. Not to mention we got no discount on the bill for the mistake with my order. Another point too is that appetizers are extremely over priced. We ordered a pretzel appetizer one time and only got a few pretzels and it was $12! Not to mention a small appetizer Cesar salad is $13. Lastly, I have to point out that the waiting area is way too small for the amount of costumers, I couldn&#39;t imagine going on a Saturday night. So overall yes I would recommend this location but you should really confirm with the server that what you are ordering is what you are getting as it is listed on the menu.

This Cheesecake location is solid. The wait staff is pleasant and the food is what you can expect from a Cheesecake Factory. The host staff&#39;s attitudes can be a little 50/50, but they do what they can with the hoards of people that eat here.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. My last visit went very well, our server was very attentive and recommended a lot and knew the menu well. Our food took a little while to come out but we went on a Friday night so I can understand a delay. My own bad thing was my chocolate cake came out cold so I did not want to eat a ice cold piece of cake and had to take it home.

Towson&#39;s Cheesecake Factory is just like any other. The wait can get very long but you always get the quality food that&#39;s a little over priced, but you know you&#39;re going to spend that much when you go to Cheesecake. <br>When I&#39;ve ordered cheesecake from the bakery area, it&#39;s always been crowded and the wait for just one or two pieces of cheesecake can get a little long. The workers are usually pretty frantic and working as hard as they can so its not really their fault. But definitely think the management should figure out how to speed up the process.

So it&#39;s honestly been about 15 years since I&#39;ve eaten in a Cheesecake Factory and I wasn&#39;t a huge fan back then. My recent visit to this location didn&#39;t do much to change my mind. I don&#39;t think it&#39;s anything I can really put my finger on, but I&#39;m just not as impressed as others.<br><br>We arrived on a a Sunday - early afternoon and we&#39;re told it would be 15-20 minutes...40 minutes later we were seated...another 10 before we were asked about drinks and another 10 before we got the drinks...so an HOUR after we walked in the door we got our drinks.  I get it, you&#39;re busy, but you are ALWAYS busy...have enough people working!<br><br>So the food itself was pretty good.  My daughter really liked her fish and chips and Cesar salad not the best she had, but she liked it.  My sine thought his chicken parm sandwich on french garlic bread WAS one of the tastiest he&#39;s had...and he swears it was the garlic bread.  <br><br>My wife wasn&#39;t that hungry so she just ordered a house salad and a white chicken chili. She enjoyed it and said it was very flavorful and savory and just the right amlint...though she would have preferred it a bit spicier.  I tried the fish tacos wanted to have two grilled and two fried, but apparently that&#39;s impossible so I got all four fried. They were very good, as were the black beans.  We finished the meal with a slice of a chocolate cheesecake, which was very good, but not as good as Mom&#39;s. <br><br>So the service wasn&#39;t great...but I don&#39;t blame my server-side was just too busy and wasn&#39;t getting help from the bar or kitchen.  I&#39;ve always thought Cheesecake Factory just tries to be too much...menu is huge and I don&#39;t think you can have superior food when you are trying to do so many different meals.

I had an issue with multiple members of the rude curbside team  at 9:10pm on 2/16/19 it took three calls and five different people to attempt to place the order I then arrived and they had failed to submit my order nor did they come out when I called to alert them of my arrival, so I called and asked for the manager. The manager Chris sprung into action and promptly &amp; politely came out in less than 2min and personally re-took my order, he then expedited it and hand delivered the hot meal curbside in a few short minutes. Chris was empathetic and provided outstanding service making sure my concerns were remedied before I left the restaurant!. Kudos to Chris for the top notch service and my stellar experience with Manager Chris will be the sole reason I come back to the Towson Cheesecake Factory!.

Today my girlfriend and I came here to grab something quick to eat.  She ordered a pasta dish. I ordered the chicken and shrimp gumbo.  My food came out amazing, her&#39;s not so much.  However,  our waiter Wade and the manager Lafonte went above and beyond to make our experience memorable and much better.  I recommend asking for them whenever you go.

I have had a large variety from the Cheesecake Factory in Towson. Sliders, pasta carbonara, loaded potatoes, mac and cheese balls, edamame, etc, as well as dabbling in my fair share of cheesecakes. I love Cheesecake Factory and I talk about coming here whenever the opportunity presents itself. The food is rich and the portions are huge and worth the expense. You will go home not only satisfied once but satisfied twice as you will most likely have leftovers. <br>This is a nice location although if it&#39;s possible to go to the one at the inner harbor, it is worth going as it is beautiful, spacious, and has great service! The outdoor seating in Towson is noisy but still pretty. Both locations are great for dates, parties/gatherings, or just hanging out. <br>I will say that they definitely skimp out on cheesecake when it is for take out. I was given a sliver from Towson for the same price as dining in. Not cool. Would rather dine in, just order cheesecake, and take it home.

It was ok. I went for the impossible burger, which they were out of. I&#39;m happy it&#39;s selling well but they should probably keep a lot on hand as they don&#39;t have a lot of vegan options. Our server was nice but it just felt dingy.

Off to a slowwwww start here. We like the food , been here before but the service is not fast!!! 10 minutes and still no drink, that&#39;s poor service!!! The worst part is, the station is next to our table. So he finally has a drink for us but it&#39;s water, we ordered tea! <br><br>Back again and Phil did a great job with service!!!! The food is always fabulous!!!

I&#39;m giving two stars becouse this place was just that bad. The menu is huge, don&#39;t know the exact number but around 14 pages long. I ended up choosing the chicken crusted Romano ($17). While waiting on my food, i also had to wait on my drink to be refilled, for at least 5 to 10 minutes as many a waitress and waiter passed by it sat empty. Finally I had to stop a waitress passing by in order to get my drink refilled.<br><br>This was a Tuesday night, with no wait to be seated mind you, so no legit reason for anything to be taking so long. <br><br>When our food arrived, my noodles where under cooked and the chicken.... well for $17, when you order what is essentially chicken parmesan, you picture a real piece of chicken and fully cooked noodles. The chicken was more of a McDonald&#39;s nugget style. Not real chicken, more like mashed meat, formed and shaped into a flat piece of meat with a crust on it. Not at all what $17 Should have gotten me.<br><br>The drink I ordered was a long island iced tea. Which is 90% alcohol. Not this drink, 10% alcohol max. It was so watered down it tasted more along the lines of a soda than an alcoholic beverage, and they cost over $11 to boot.<br><br>The service was extremely slow. Literraly over 10 minutes just for the waitress to get the check and bring it back. Unreal.<br><br>End of story, I will NOT be coming back to this place ever again, and with so many other options nearby, why would anyone want to come here?

This is our first time at Cheesecake Factory in Towson, MD, came here with boyfriend to get appetizers: wings, tex-mex egg rolls and cream of mushroom soup. There was not a wait which is always great therefore we were seated immediately. Our waitress was kind and attentive. Sadly cream of mushroom soup was not on the menu that night (few nights ago I believe Wednesday). The tex-mex egg-rolls were overly saturated in grease so we couldn&#39;t eat those, just had our waitress throw them out. They were paid for. The wings were good- they always are. We also tried for the first time pulled pork sliders which boyfriend obsessed over, ended up ordering another. Overall things were good. Thanks for having us!

We are regulars and the kitchen was off tonight my. Sauces were bland and threw off the taste of everything. Bread was stale and kitchen didn&#39;t seem to care quality was off. Hopefully this was a one night incident because we really enjoyed meals here preciously. Server Ace was ok. Only problem he was defending the poor sauces. Ended up taking food to go. The dining experience was not great. :(
Ugh I love Cheesecake Factory. I go there periodically and I honestly am never disappointed. Always good food and good staff.

Extremely disappointed in my visit ONCE again. The last time i came here i avoided writing a nasty review because people make mistakes, but once again the disrespectful, uneducated staff had the audacity to be rude with us. The first time, i asked nicely where the bread was since I had been at my table for 24 mins and the MANAGER told me that &#34;they had none and when they did we&#39;ll get it so be patient&#34; and walked away with anger on his face..... id be happy to be patient if you didn&#39;t talk to me that way as a manager, who is hired to be an upper hand member of the staff. Today (10/15) i was yelled by the lady who cuts cheesecakes at front for 1) not stepping aside and 2) because I asking where my slice was after i had paid for it and waited over 10 mins to be served a READY piece of cake. <br><br>To cheesecake factory: maybe you should reconsider who your hiring when you do so since your staff all seems to be so unmannered and dead in the head. RULE OF THUMB : TREAT YOUR GUESTS WITH RESPECT AND MAKE THEM FEEL WELCOMED!!!!

Over the years the Cheesecake Factory has become one my least favorite restaurants to dine at. Since I was in the area, I decided to give them another try. After this visit, my mind has not changed. I never understood why the lighting is so dim that you can barely read the menu and see your entree when served. The menu items serving size has become smaller and the cost larger. I ordered the explosive shrimp that wasn&#39;t bad. The fried shrimp was bland, no taste. The dipping sauce had all the flavoring. I guess that is what makes the shrimp explosive. For my entree I ordered the grilled salmon. The presentation of my entree was nice. I was disappointed when I tasted the salmon...it was dried out. My steamed veggies had no seasoning &amp; were hard. The mashed potatoes were the only thing that wasn&#39;t bad on my plate.

I ordered a cobb salad.. It came but I wanted different chicken so u asked the server to please instead of chicken breast I just wanted grilled chicken...they put lunch meat on the cobb salad!!!! Not grilled as described...i know I&#39;m not at a fancy place but at least be honest with the description..also the bread came out stiff but slightly warm‍ this place needs new servers because they aren&#39;t the best..last time I came and I was satisfied but this might maybe wasn&#39;t the best but it will be the last and then I went to speak with the manager and AL he did was make excuses &#34;Uh Uh sorry..I understand&#34; yeah typical read from a manual of &#34; what to say when a customer is upset&#34; I didn&#39;t bother..still hungry and pissed..the manager &#34;Brian&#34; said &#34;your not the only person were cooking for so the chicken takes long&#34; actually it doesn&#39;t..your cooking gmo chicken that can be warmed up and grilled in 5 min..your server was being a dick and so we&#39;re u sir but due to the average stars this place gets. Its no shocker..GROSS

After walking the huge mall we decided to take a load off and eat here. It was an early time and although a Saturday I didn&#39;t think it would be too hard. The wait was about 5 minutes. <br><br>I asked for a GF menu, the hostess said that it is now a part of the regular menu - which is nice! I know how large their menu is but it&#39;s nice to see that some can be modified for my GF diet. We were placed in a 2-top near the bar. <br><br>When we sat down, I got up to use the restroom. Told my girlfriend to order me a water. Came out of the restroom, she hadn&#39;t arrived yet. 15 minutes later, still nothing. I told her I&#39;d say something in 2 minutes but by then someone had popped over. We had picked what we wanted to order, so when she said &#34;let me get you rdrinks&#34; I said &#34;no, we can order.&#34; I didn&#39;t want to lose her again! I ordered the chopped salad - gluten free. Dressing on the side. <br><br>We waited 35 minutes for our salads. I never saw the waitress again. When someone else brought me my salad, it looked great and I said... &#34;Actually I got dressing on the side, is there already dressing on it?&#34; She said &#34;No. But you got gluten free... and the only GF dressing we have is oil and vinegar.&#34; <br><br>...to which I replied... &#34;Then...can I have that?&#34; <br><br>Ugh it was just a frustrating experience. There was a huge wait when we left. I&#39;m a former server so I feel the pain of a busy Saturday lunch crowd but come on. It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;re always busy. Our waitress was nice, but neglectful. It wasn&#39;t a nice experience. The food was good, but that&#39;s all.

I am in love with the firecracker salmon appetizers. I sat at the bar having drinks, chatting people up, and talking to the bartenders for a smooth 3 hours.  The kitchen was a bit slow with getting meals out; however, it was exceptionally busy (there was a wait to be seating in the main dining area).  The drinks were delicious and well made and I especially enjoy the dirty martinis and sangria here.  I&#39;ll definitely be back to treat myself to a nice dinner and drinks again.

Overall, it was very nice. <br><br>Pros:<br>The staff was friendly and attentive. <br>The food was excellent.<br>Call me Capitan Obvious, but the lemon cheesecake was outstanding. <br><br>Con:<br>It&#39;s too dark in there. I couldn&#39;t read the menu without using the flashlight function on my phone.

Love love love the Cheesecake Factory-especially Towson&#39;s!<br><br>Whenever my friend is in town we make the drive down to Towson for some shopping and cheesecake.  We&#39;ve never had a long wait and have always had excellent service and food!  This past trip our waitress was Carol (I hope I&#39;ve spelled it right!)-officially one of my favorite people.  She was so sweet and absolutely hilarious.  We loved finding out that she&#39;s from York too!  She made sure our trip was worth it.  Carol, we love you and hope you&#39;re working next time we&#39;re in Towson!<br><br>On a more &#34;Yelp review&#34; note, I have never had a poor experience at this location.  The food and drinks are always done well.  I highly recommend the Fried Macaroni and Cheese appetizer, the Hershey&#39;s cheesecake, Mango Key Lime cheesecake, or the Kahlua Cocoa Coffee cheesecake for dessert, and my new favorite, the Caribbean Cooler for a drink.  It is one of the tastiest blended drinks I&#39;ve ever had.  At first I thought it was a virgin, but then again, the drink is better when you can&#39;t taste the alcohol right? ;)<br><br>I always have luck parking in the garage right by the restaurant.  If you&#39;r driving down Dulaney Valley from the I83 side, turn left right before the mall and you&#39;ll find a garage that also offers valet parking.
I had a good experience at this restaurant! Vincent our waiter was very good and funny! Would totally recommend!

We were a party of 20. It&#39;s an hour+ wait but Chris, the manager, came over personally to provide time/table updates. We were made to sit, wait and wonder into oblivion. We&#39;ll remember TCF the next time, the next kid joins the US ARMY. Thanks Chris
Always a good meal here with incredible cheesecakes. Good food carries the place because the menu is dreadfully long, and plating is horrendous.

This place is always busy, but it is so worth the wait. You will find a ton of options on the menu here. I have never ordered the same entree twice and everything has always been delicious. On my last visit I ordered a chopped salad from the Skinnylicious menu which was excellent. It had a delicious dressing, grilled chicken, bacon, avocado, corn, tomatoes, etc. The portion size was perfect; about half the size of one ordered from the standard menu. Those salads are huge. I can never finish them and I think leftover salads are just gross, so i liked this better. If you order any entrees from the standard menu prepare to have leftovers. Of course the cheesecakes here are fantastic, too. My favorite is the Pineapple Upside Down cake. I have also had the Hershey&#39;s chocolate cheesecake and the Red Velvet. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is, in my opinion, the best option for eating at the Towson Town Center.
Standard Cheesecake Factory menu. Staff is friendly but slow with service. Food tastes great and prices are reasonable.

At this point, if you haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory, you need to boost your social life! I&#39;ve been to this location many times, so here is my all inclusive review:<br><br>Things I Like:<br>- Without question, the most robust menu in all of restaurantland. They have EVERYTHING, aaaaand they launched a &#34;skinny&#34; menu. <br>- Full bar with creative specialty drinks.<br>- Ridiculous amount of fun choices for cheesecake/dessert. Can&#39;t go wrong with any of it.<br>- Most importantly, they might have THE BEST WAITSTAFF SERVICE in the county. Management there has done a great job creating a culture that spoils it&#39;s guests.<br><br>Things I Don&#39;t Like: <br>- Prices are taller than usual chain restaurant, and quantities match. While paying a little extra is sometimes necessary to have better food, I feel the overbearing quantities that go to waste are what I am actually paying for. But some fans of Cheesecake Factory really value this aspect.<br>- MAKING YOUR CUSTOMERS WAIT. On a Friday or Saturday night you will arrive and wait for a table between 45 minutes to an hour. A whole blob of impatient and hungry people get blinking vibrators to taunt them as they wait I a &#34;holding pen&#34; type if area. This is awful. CF doesn&#39;t take reservations. This is kind of lame. I no longer go to this restaurant on hose nights, and I go less often overall.<br><br>In conclusion, any other day of the week besides Friday/Saturday, this place is great. I have them 4 stars. To earn 5, they need to take better care of their guests and establish a reservation system that eliminates abusive waiting experiences.

The service was okay but not exemplary. My food was less than okay and I am not a happy camper. How do you mess up an omelette I&#39;m not really sure. As soon as it came out I knew it was going to be gross. Even the presentation wasn&#39;t good. Also did I mention how spongey my eggs were. Kind of reminded me off the carton eggs they give you at a complimentary breakfast. That&#39;s exactly why I sent these back. They needed to be complimentary.

I really don&#39;t eat at a lot of chain restaurants and here is the reason why. I ordered a Strawberry Shake with Vodka and received a dirty strawberry and the dirt fell into the shake. The server told me it&#39;s not dirt. Ok well what is it then? Yelpers you be the judge.

The wait is the usual 30 or so minutes. Food is delicious! On a recent trip, my friend&#39;s daughter lost her tooth during the meal--the manager played Tooth Fairy and gave her a dollar bill! How nice.<br>Always pleased with the quality of food.

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake factory 3 times now. Once was with a friend at the Inner harbor and the other two times were with friends at the Towson location. The menu is very large and usually takes us a bit to decide on what to get. My favorite item is the Cobb salad. Its enough for two meals. Fresh crisp lettuce with chicken, avocado, egg, cheese and plenty more toppings. I have them toss it with blue cheese dressing since I&#39;m not a fan of other dressings. I also enjoy the mojitos. They have the traditional flavor or you can mix it up with some fruit. I recommend the passion fruit. I&#39;m not very adventurous when it comes to cheesecake flavors so the two slices I&#39;ve had were good but nothing to brag about. <br><br>This place is always packed. So be prepared to wait. To kill time while waiting we decided to walk around the mall and see all the stores Towson town center had to offer. The prices of most things are average.

I know, I know people love this place. Frankly, I feel that it is very over done. Way too much food and not like it is a bargain, they sure charge you for it. Maybe this is a great business model, and it sure seems to be but I think this is the Golden Corral for the upper middles.<br><br>They food was good, not great. The wine selection was a quaffer&#39;s delight (nothing noteworthy), service was adequate and the atmosphere could only be described as cacophonous. I could not hear myself think. I&#39;ll only go here if everyone else wants.

The service is extremely poor, my food came out cold but the plate was extremely hot so it had obviously been sitting under a heat lamp, put in an order for a drink from the bar (which was not busy at the time as we were seated right next to it), 20 minutes later I asked our server where my drink was and she tells me she forgot to put it in. Over all poor service for a dinner that pricey. Will never go back.

Lousy management. Lousy. I&#39;m not a huge fan of Cheesecake Factory to begin with. But this place sets a new low in terms of organization and service. Told me wait was 20 minutes. Actual wait was 45. Then waited an hour before food arrived. Then my burger came with a giant chunk out of it. Like a big bite. Taken by someone who was not me. I don&#39;t actually think it was a bite but I&#39;m still not sure how else a giant half moon chunk was missing from my burger. Or why. <br><br>You&#39;ve been warned!

Dined here many of times with family and friends. <br>Customer Service has been great all times. I enjoy the portion sizes lol because I always get to take some home and eat it another day.<br>My waittress is always very pleasant. <br>My go to dish is the bang bang chicken and shrimp <br>And red velvet cupcake. <br>Anyone can find something on the menu. Go and enjoy

Absolute nightmare.  Never!  Ever!  Ever come here.  The worst service I&#39;ve ever experienced.  They couldn&#39;t get anything right.  This is no joke.  We had to leave.  And then they tried to make us pay for our meal.  It NEVER came!!!<br>Don&#39;t waste your time.  Server was an idiot.  Her manager was even worse.  This place needs to clean house and train staff.  <br><br>Save your time and high blood pressure meds.  You&#39;d be better off at McDonald&#39;s. Heck, Denny&#39;s even is higher brow.  <br><br>If I could give negative stars - I would. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory Towson is a colossal failure !!!

The reason I gave two star is because of the experience ordering phone by phone. I was placed on hold for an eternity. While on hold they should have had a recording indicating orders could be placed online. The lady that picked up the phone said that is just busy on Fridays. Well if it that busy hire more staff
