Came today with a fairly large party and the food service was stellar!!!  Awesome experience by the entire team.  The food, bread, apetizers..... Everything was great.  Kudos on a job well done.

I always order my cheesecake curbside pickup; however, this evening after waiting on hold for ten minutes I was informed that pickup orders for cheesecake are not allowed. I work in the mall and only wanted to pick it up curbside. Oh AND ALL of the 15 minute curbside parking spaces were occupied by patrons who definitely were there longer than 15 minutes. A HUGE inconvenience for a restaurant whose main staple is CHEESECAKE!

7:30 pm at night , busy time for the restaurant business on Friday night ! <br>I would say the counter should have a cashier stand by any time ! We been waiting for a while for orders ! No body take the orders right the way ! Not really acceptable !<br>If it is too busy on weekend , please hire one more cashier !

Service was terrible. I waited 20 minutes for my waitress to come back to my table after I was finished dinner. Ordered a piece of cheesecake to go and my check. I watched this same waitress standing around the waitress station for 10 minutes more talking to all of her coworkers while I waited for my check. Still waiting for my cheesecake as well. I did not plan to spend my evening sitting in the Cheesecake Factory waiting for side conversations to end.

I am not the biggest fan of the overrated cheese cake factory menu however I do occasionally make a trip out to this congested, no parking, busy Towson area to grab a slice of cheesecake. Honestly, how I feel about this chain restaurant is this: back in the day red lobster used to be the go to spot for the dope boys to impress a lady nowadays red lobster has fallen off the grid and is now replaced by the Cheesecake Factory. So it is just a fancier chain restaurant to go on a first date or take the family now.
It&#39;s your typical Cheesecake Factory. In a city dearth of quality restaurants, we are stuck with mediocrity.

It is what it is. It&#39;s an expensive chain with slightly fancier food than others, and a price to make sure you know it. I wouldn&#39;t go here normally - just too much money for what it is, and it&#39;s always super crowded with obnoxious people. However, I won a gift card while playing BINGO at my daughter&#39;s school, so why not? The chicken sandwich was pretty nice, and the fries it came with were decent. My girlfriend got a pasta dish of some sort and that was also good. The cheesecake is really where the magic happens... It&#39;s a lot of money, though. And when you&#39;re done, you don&#39;t need to eat any more calories for the next three days!<br><br>Service was just average.

Not many things could be said of Cheesecake Factory negatively. It&#39;s reputation of a upscale comfort food establishment is true. However, I must dissect this Towson location and even comment on a few issues controlled by corporate. The location is nice and most importantly clean. However, I don&#39;t understand the decor. It&#39;s quite confusing and kinda reminds me of an Indian restaurant. The food prices are not super pricey, but certainly not the most affordable. The food came hot 25 minutes after ordering but the portions seemed skimpy. I like most people love cheesecake so I obviously ordered a slice. To be honest, I expected to be in cheesecake heaven. I thought I&#39;d have my life flash before my eyes after biting into what&#39;s supposed to be the best cheesecake on earth. But that wasn&#39;t the case. It&#39;s a middle of the road cheesecake that extremely overpriced. I guess that&#39;s why when you look around the restaurant you don&#39;t see many people actually ordering it. They have plenty of options in terms of flavors but how do you price a slice of cheesecake almost as much as a steak entree? While the food is decent and the atmosphere is confusing but decent, the most important factor of this restaurant is disappointing. But it&#39;s not bad...

This was our first time at the Cheesecake factory. We came in and seated quickly. Our server&#39;s Name was Annie who was pleasant and very informative. We started off with Crispy Crab Wonton. Which was well received by my picky eaters. My oldest son ordered the Herb Crusted Filet of Salmon which he found tender and perfectly seasoned. My youngest had their pizza and he was pleased. I had the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo. It had a bit of a kick, but that is what I expect with gumbo. It was so much food we had to take a majority home. Our first time there impression was great. Your pleasant staff (Annie) and the lady who brought the appetizer to the table who I did not catch a name were great! Thank you and we look forward to another trip back sometime in the future.
Service has greatly improved from last visit.  While there were a few hiccups in the food presented, our waiter was awesome.
If you ask for fettuccini Alfredo they will sneak a tomato in there . So make sure you tell them your food allergies and they don&#39;t do reservations so get there asap

Was expecting to have a romantic date with my girlfriend until Janice started singing happy birthday in my damn ear.. 5 times. It was not my birthday. Don&#39;t even get me started on the little shit that kept sliding his chair into our table. Control ya damn kids. Food was good tho.
Huge selection and if you go early 11:30 it&#39;s not busy at all. Nice wait staff, and reasonable pricing.

The service was terrible and the bathrooms were gross. We were disrespected by the manager and the server. Marisa was the server. Invoking policy is one thing, plain rudeness is another. Never going back.

I have been to this Cheesecake Factory numerous of times but this last time was bad. The young lady named Amanda who helped me with my togo order was perfect. She was very nice and had a smile on her face. I ordered chicken scampi. That pasta was drowning in oil. Heart attack waiting to happen. I ordered tiramisus but instead another young lady gave me tiramisu cheesecake. Crazy but I am not a big fan of cheesecake.I called and told the manger how they gave me the wrong dessert. He asked if I had my receipt and I said no. I had made two separate orders and lost the receipt with the dessert. His response was to come in and get a new slice but I told him I could not leave work. I asked if I can come in tomorrow he told me no. To make a long story short he one did not even try and solve the issue and two he low key thought I was lying about being there in the first place.
The ambiance was fabulous, the Sausage and Shrimp Pasta was terrific and the Lemon Raspberry Cheesecake was life changing! 5 Stars doesn&#39;t do this place justice!!!

I have been going to this location for a long time and service is definitely declining. Even though you are given a time to pick up when ordering online they are rarely ready and tonite was no exception. Three people deep in line and 5-6 people behind the counter - a few working on desserts, the rest, clustered in the corner and no one waiting on pick-up customers! When I received my order I should have checked, A chopped salad missing avocado and no instructions (that they ask you to type into &#39;customize&#39; your salad) followed. No bread included this time - they must have forgotten that. At least I received 3 forks?! Very disappointing...

Manager was being very rude to me and family because of is having 20 people in a group. First told my sister at 2:00 to come back at 5 for a table but my sister was told on the phone from someone to come two hours ahead of time for a 4pm seating.. When we got back at 5 gave us one of those devices and said we have we have to wait two hours for seating.. Will never go back there again.. Customer Service sucks!!!

Poor customer service. Bought $200 worth of gift cards with a free piece of cheesecake for each $25 gift card. They will only let you let you use 1 free cheesecake per carry out order despite spending $75. Last time I will be doing that! Not everyone can go to a restaurant. Some people are handicapped and rely on others to enjoy food from a restaurant.

I&#39;m not really a fan of these chain restaurants, but this one is ok. No frills, just consistent Cheesecake Factory dishes. I will say the Mushroom Swiss burger I had was perfect!  They really should promote their burgers more. IJS that menu is so huge it&#39;s hard to pinpoint what else is on the menu outside of cheesecake.

This was my first time being at The Cheesecake Factory.<br>Our seating was excellent as we had a good view of the restaurant and staff is very friendly!<br>Our waitress, Katie, was phenomenal and on top of things and answered any questions that we had.<br>The appetizers, Crab balls and the fried Zucchini, were AWESOME!<br>Our meals were more than enough to eat, taking leftovers home for the next day.<br>The Lemon Raspberry cheesecake was delicious!<br>Can&#39;t wait to go back again

Horrible customer service! I place a phone order and told the lady my order. I repeated my order three times in order for her to get my order correct. She was too busy talking to other in the background while taking my order. Once i received my order it was completely wrong. I told the worker who handed me my order that it was wrong and she just walked away as I was talking to her. Another lady came by and fixed the problem.

We ordered the curbside to go and it was a disaster. We figured that we&#39;d call and place our order before the dinner rush. While the on the phone they told us that it would be 30 minutes.<br><br>I arrived at the curb and in front of their white backdoor about 25 minutes after we placed our order. I called to let them know that I had arrived for our order that we called in. I watched as they walked out of the door and delivered to other drivers in their car. Each time another employee walked out, they walked right past my car.<br><br>After sitting there for 30 minutes, I called again to let them know I was still there and again provided them with the color and make of my car and even told them that I was parked right in front of the door, where they were walking out. The girl said, &#34;Ok&#34;.<br><br>Another 20 minutes passed and I again called to tell them I was there to pick up an order and gave them the name of the order and again, the make and color of my car and my location. The guy on the phone didn&#39;t seem to care and had a slight arrogance to his voice, almost annoyed that I was calling. During the entire fiasco, there wasn&#39;t any employee who walked out with food and took it back.<br><br>My wife called to find out what was going on and I told her. She too, called the restaurant where they proceeded to tell her that they&#39;d look into. After sitting next to the curb, in front of the door that they walked out of, for an hour I finally left, angry.<br><br>As a customer, we did everything that we were supposed to. Cheesecake Factory, as a provider of goods and services, failed miserably in their responsibilities.<br><br>After I arrived home, my wife called to speak to the manager. To our surprise, he lied right to her, telling her that on three different occasions, they walked out and couldn&#39;t locate me. I can&#39;t believe a manager would do something like that. This particular location needs to start over with their staff, from the hostess all the way up to the manager. Every visit we have had horrible customer service and when we bring it up, no one seems to care.

Stopped by this location with my family and friends that we havent seen in years. In this day and age, customers having food allergies and unable to eat certain things is understandable. Apparently not to the manager named Brian/Bryan that works at this location. My godmother has very particular food allergies so when she orders something she has throughly asked the waiter for the food she is interested in. Apparently in the kitchen, they add sauces and such to food and send it out to tables. This was the case with her salad which had salmon and came out topped in a mayonnaise sauce. In this instance, she didnt want her food made all over again. She asked the manager that her meal price be cut in half since it wasnt an added protein, it came with the salmon on it. The manager Brian/Bryan would not oblige and only would give us the price of additional salmon which was much less than what the entire salad was worth. This was all while Completely blaming her for not expressing her food allergies while ordering. This is so inconsiderate because if the chef in the back didnt add things to a meal that isnt on the menu itself, we wouldn&#39;t be in this situation. Terrible customer service.

The hostesses were extremely friendly. The wait was longer than we were told, about 40 mins when they told us 20, but that&#39;s okay. Our waiter was John. He was so nice and very helpful with our questions. The food was good, I got a salad and it was huge. John always made sure we weren&#39;t low on water which was nice because some restaurants take forever to refill. The Cheesecake was still frozen :( which kind of ruined the greatness of the rest of the experience. But I would return to cheese cake factory

I have never waited longer in a restaurant like this. Our waitress seated us and dispearred since. Our drink was not served until we are half done with the meal. Never came back since. And we had to get another waitress to pay for the food. Very bad exprience and definitely not coming back.
What a great place.  Took Ms Angie out to celebrate her 28 birthday.  <br><br>Love the food

Great Cheesecake! Smooth, plenty of toppings, and even a little extra side of cool whip Mmmmm<br><br>Food isn&#39;t bad either. Salads are crazy BIG! Some of there sandwiches could use better fitting names though. The &#34;Pit Dip&#34; is far from pit beef. The &#34;Pulled Pork&#34; is now a Carolina style Pork Sandwich? That was what I mistakenly ordered. I sent it back too! There pulled pork sandwich used to be phenomenal! Had it many times over the years. Now it&#39;s a sloppy mess with an overload of unneeded fixings. What a shame! <br><br>Only thing I really don&#39;t like is the wait time. Friday-Sunday is so busy! Good luck getting a table in under an hour. Shame they don&#39;t offer call ahead seating or reservations. I&#39;d go there more if they did. <br><br>I recommend this place for weekday/weeknights and early bird meals. If you go during the weekend, go shopping instead of standing in there for an hour.

Visited this restaurant for lunch. Not busy at all. Ordered a water and a ginger ale. Never got the ginger ale. Ordered a turkey burger and a chicken sandwich. Turkey burger was raw, not cooked. Waiter asked if we wanted it out on the grill longer or another item of the menu. That question should not have been asked. Manager came and apologized. All in all a bad experience

The experience was a pleasant one.  The food did not disappoint and service was quick and efficient.   The only thing that was annoying to this writer is the loud and uptempo music that detracted from the dining conversation. Otherwise, this is a good value for the money.

Highly recommend. Came here 2x while staying for a soccer tournament. Food is yummy: fried catfish; mash potato; free beans and onions; also had the gumbo.. Oh and the Lemondrop Martini&#39;s to die for.... Tasty. Wait was long but it was the week end but service was ok

I took my son here on a Saturday evening for dinner. It was our first time visiting this location but have dined at several other locations previously. I ordered the Jamaican Black Pepper Chicken and Shrimp. I have ordered this dish many times and immediately knew it wasn&#39;t made well. The shrimp and chicken were unusually small and the plantains were missing. I had a huge amount of rice and black beans, and the amount of pineapples on the plate was minuscule. I believe my dish was rushed as the seasoning tasted as though it was just sprinkled on top. My son ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, his entire dish was salty. We ate about half the meal and ordered our cheesecake to go. Our Cheesecake was great as usual. I think this may have just been a fluke because I have always had a great experience at this chain. The dining room was packed and had a long line. Our server Andy was also great!! We&#39;ll try this location again so I hope it was just a bad night.

Let me start off by saying I&#39;ve always been a huge fan of TCF and have been craving one of my favorite entrees from TCF, the orange chicken.  Well, living about 45 mins away, I don&#39;t make it down that way that often.  An opportunity became available when my wife asked me to bring her some cheesecake for lunch at her work up the street.  I went online and ordered for curbside pickup.  The order was supposed to be ready at 12:26 and I arrived at 12:10.  As always, all the displayed pickup spots taken by mall patrons clearly not picking up from any restaurants.  I assumed when filling out my vehicle info and being given a pickup time, they would bring out the food when ready or possibly have someone designated to curbside check from time to time.  Nope, I ended up calling around 12:45.  I was told I was supposed to call when I arrived which being a first time curbside patron, I did not know.   Not very pleased, I just wanted to leave since my wife&#39;s lunch break was now half over.  By the time I got to my wife&#39;s work(10 mins away), the food was somewhat cold and the cheesecake was room temp.  My orange chicken which i was REALLY looking forward to was very bland and didn&#39;t have much flavor.  The southwestern egg rolls were greasy too the point of throwing out.  My wife&#39;s club sandwich was 30% mayo.  The only thing good about the experience was the cheesecake(go figure).  Although room temp, it was very food.  This lunch treat was not in anyway worth the near $100 price.  A big disappointment all around.

I had great lunch and great dinner here. Food was well made, the right amount of crunch, and the right amount of flavor. Portions were generous and I had lots of leftovers. Their sliders were amazing, in fact, I am craving them now. Service was friendly and efficient every time, though there was a long wait to be seated since they were so busy. Good place!

I usually love everything I get here from the entrées to the appetizers and cocktails. Here are my favorites:<br>Drinks- Mai tai, mojito, mango mojito, long island and rum punch. All are made strong, delicious and garnished beautifully. <br>Appetizers- Avocado eggrolls (FAVORITE), buffalo chicken crisps, firecracker salmon rolls, crab balls, dynamite shrimp...I could go on and on literally all the apps are amazing!<br>Entrees- I never thought I&#39;d say this but the Kale and quinoa salad is AMAZING!!! It&#39;s hands down my favorite thing to get now. It comes in a huge proportion with a delicious lemon vinaigrette dressing. The perfect balance of sweet and salty. Other entress that are good is the Louisiana chicken. The portions here are very big and filling so plan to take home a to go box. The cheesecake speaks for itself. There are dozens of flavors and they all taste delicious! My favorites are the lemonchello, peanut butter, red velvet, key lime, banana cream, oreo, strawberry and turtle. Fyi the happy hour is also really nice. They have $6 food and drink items. Enjoy!

For me to say that I will never return to restaurant the experience has to be pretty bad. My family and I went to the Cheesecake Factory for my sister&#39;s birthday. Prior to this I had noticed that the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food wasn&#39;t as good as it used to be. However, I loved the bread and the cheesecake and the food was better than most places so I would at least frequent this restaurant 2-3 times per year.<br><br>This last visit however turned out to be the catalyst that ensures that I will never again visit any Cheesecake Factory! Six of us went to the restaurant on that Sunday. I could talk about how the initial server was either incompetent or just didn&#39;t like us due to the way she acted. However, that was not the &#34;highlight&#34; of the evening. One of my other sisters has a severe pineapple allergy. This was made clear when ordering drinks and food, to the point where my sister even chose a different drink because the staff was unsure what ingredients were in it(how does that work?)<br><br>My sister asked whether or not the meal she was ordering had pineapples in it (Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp). She was assured that it did not. If anyone has seen this particular dish, you know that it is completely covered with sauce. My sister received her meal and began to eat it, without really paying much attention. As she began to eat it, she began to cough severely and complain of trouble breathing to the point of tears. My mom immediately began to urge her to drink water as we looked for a benadryl to give her. My brother grabbed her plate and looked through her food and discovered not one but several pineapple chunks in the food. He tasted it to confirm.<br><br>We gave her a benadryl and she could breathe a little better. So we called the manager over and explained the situation. We showed him the pineapple and he exclaimed&#34; Oh my God. They&#39;re all through the dish&#34; He rushed back to the kitchen and came back with the Kitchen manager, who tried to persuade us that there weren&#39;t any pineapples in the dish but rather it was applesauce! APPLESAUCE!<br><br>What kind of morons, did he think we were to believe that a pineapple chunk was applesauce?! The kitchen manager became snide with us and at no point did they take responsibility for the mistake they made. My sister began to experience the worsening of symptoms. It was obvious that she needed something stronger than benadryl. We told them we were rushing my sister to Patient First because the benadryl wasn&#39;t working and the manager says, &#34;Oh yes, let me get your check to you so that you can be on your way&#34; They wanted to make sure we paid before we went to see to my sister&#39;s wellbeing!<br><br>I later spoke to the general manager and my sister spoke to corporate. They refused to acknowledge the fact of what they&#39;d done. The woman from corporate told my sister to take a picture next time. Both were extremely rude and acted as if we&#39;d inconvenienced them! I told the manager, our family was the one who was sitting at patient first after what was supposed to be a birthday celebration. My sister had to receive several shots and was on medication for a week after that episode.<br><br>At no point did Cheesecake Factory take ownership of their mistake. I will never be returning to their restaurant. Maybe it won&#39;t make a difference to them. However I hope if anyone has a food allergy that you do not visit this restaurant. You could die and they wouldn&#39;t care. They&#39;d tell you as the woman in corporate said &#34; Take a picture next time&#34; That &#34;picture&#34; is worth a thousand words. It tells you just what they think of their customers.

I don&#39;t usually have anything but good experiences here and I have been eating at Cheesecake Factory restaurants since 1986 when I lived in Los Angeles. For one thing, they give you LOADS of food! A total and complete contribution to the country&#39;s obesity problem. Lots of yummy food for the price and a gazillion calories!! The cheesecake and desserts are so good, I feel like I gain weight just looking at it. Save this place for special occasions or just go once every 2 months!

Normally love The Cheesecake Factory. Today not so much. Had the Cobb Salad, both of us. Bitter ice burg lettuce with 5 tiny morsels of bacon. $15.50 each. Not worth it. 4 pieces of chicken. Oven was broken, so no bread. Really disappointing. <br>Towson Cheesecake Factory needs to step up their game, compared to other Cheesecake Factory Restaurants.
Excellent menu and good service. We came in for a grad celebration were disappointed. Nice job everyone?!

The food is very good but it shouldn&#39;t take so long to get small plates and dessert in the middle of the afternoon. And now I&#39;m waiting for the check. To me that is like being held hostage. After you deliver the cake (7minutes after coffee) then bring the bill.

More or less, the Cheesecake Factory gives you a ton of options so everyone is satisfied if they have a particular craving. On top of that, the cheesecake menu is enormous and the portions are huge (as are the portions of most meals here).<br><br>However, don&#39;t expect anything special from the Cheesecake Factory. The basics are all good and what you would expect - pretty much anything that&#39;s not too crazy is good. However, orders that aren&#39;t so simple will be just &#34;okay.&#34; I ordered the enchiladas and my friend got a chicken sandwich, both of which were very mediocre. Another huge downside is that seats are right on top of one another, so you&#39;re esentially in conversation with the people sitting next to you.<br><br>Good spot for the family and to keep everyone happy. Not so much for 2 people looking for conversation and a good meal.

Typical cheesecake factory restaurant.  It is in the Towson mall and it is usually pretty crowded in here.  I usually really like Cheesecake factory but the service over at this one is just ok.  The servers are not mean or rude but not overly helpful either.  For the most part you will get what you expect from this cheesecake factory.

At a chain restaurant like this, for me, service and quality of food are the most important especially since I have had some bad experiences at a few chains, the cheesecake being one of them.<br>At this location food and drinks are consistently good and I have been here more times than I can remember. The service is nice, friendly and attentive.

I went here today with 3 of my friends and can say it&#39;s one of the most memorable moments of my life due to our server Antoine. Antoine is one of the most enjoyable servers I&#39;ve had in a restaurant setting. The food was good as always, but Antoine and the serving was the unsung hero of my lunch.

The fat manager with a beard that looks like Seth Rogan is one of the worst managers I have ever experienced. He has poor people skills. I wish I remembered his name because everyone else was great and the food was dank

This place is always busy, but the food is delicious... so it&#39;s worth the wait. I always get the firecracker salmon rolls. They are sooo delicious. I can never visit  without getting a slice of cheesecake. The cheesecake slices are far from small  <br><br>I love the following cheesecakes:<br>Banana Cream w/ banana sliced<br>Red Velvet <br>Caramel (there are two kinds and they are both good)<br>Original<br>Pineapple

I never ever had a bad experience at any location. The food is always good, hot, and the service is fast and friendly. The menu is a bit overwhelming because there are so many delectable choices to choose from. I&#39;ve been dining at with this restaurant for over 12 years. It&#39;s good for celebration, groups, family, and date night. The desserts are always fresh and memorable!!!

I usually come for happy hour. The food and drinks are always up to standard. However the service tends to lack. Whether it be long greet time, not knowing about the menu, or not being attentive. Besides that everything else is pretty good and I can&#39;t complain. I would like to give 3.5 stars but since that&#39;s not an option 3 it is!

My niece purchased a red velvet cake with cream cheese icing, while the cake was delicious, the proportion of cake to icing was like 1 to 2. Stop filling cakes with all this icing and give customers the fair share of cake for the price.

Lunch started out great and we had a nice waitress. My Thai lettuce wraps looked great when it arrived at our table. All was well until I noticed a dead fly in my toppings. I put it aside on my plate and was completely grossed out and wondering if I had eaten any other insects that I could not see. The waitress did get a manager immediately, but he didn&#39;t seem surprised and offered to take the meal off the bill. That would have been expected at the minimum; however, no one else at the table would eat the food out of the kitchen. The manager told us that people were going in and out for the patio seating and &#34;it happens&#34;. We were very disappointed by the response. I won&#39;t be back.

Very disappointed. Came with a group and the food was bad all around. Cold, tasteless, not as described. Our waitress was great and the cheesecake was great so those are my 2 stars, otherwise I was extremely unhappy with this location. This was my first time at the Towson location but I&#39;ve been to other locations many many times over the past 20 years.

I always enjoy a dinner or brunch at Cheesecake! This location is conveniently connected to the Towson mall. So if you become hungry from shopping and want to have a nice sit-in dinner, this is the place to go. The time to be seated takes a little while but its worth it. The outdoor seating is also very nice. I would highly recommend having a dinner here!

Cheesecake Factory has the BEST service in town. Everyone is always extremely nice. I and high quality servers. The food is amazing and reasonably priced for the portion size. I enjoy coming here to eat with friends and family all the time.

We waited around a half an hour for a table here. The service was very slow, they took fifteen minutes just to get two lemonades. Our food came out after thirty minutes, which was okay. I had the Fish and Chips. it also took them fifteen minutes to bring one piece of cheesecake to us and another twenty to get the check. Would not recommend.

My daughter and I have visited The Cheesecake Factory in Towson many times, but this is the first time we have ever received bad food.  The service was good and the main meal was decent, but the appetizer which was the Spinach Dip tasted ok but not up to par with other spinach dips that we have had.  Later that evening both of us did not feel well for the rest of the weekend.  We tried to think of other foods we have eaten, but the spinach dip was the only food we shared.  You can mark Cheesecake off of my list of places to eat.

So.., my wife and I were watching an episode of The Big Bang Theory and I suddenly had a hankering for dinner at the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I&#39;m not sure I can add any new insights for a chain that&#39;s been around so long. Colleen and I stop in to eat there about once a year. The food is always good but they tend to pile it on. (My personal belief is that a restaurant&#39;s portions should not be any more that a normal human can eat). Every thing (including my martini) was very tasty.<br><br>I had the red velvet cheesecake for desert. <br><br>Now here is where you must have a strategy to eating your dinner if you want cheesecake for desert. Don&#39;t eat the bread that comes as you sit down, order something small or simply don&#39;t eat all the food piled up in front of you and you would normally have saved room for a piece of cheesecake. (Normally is the key word here). The piece of RVCC that landed in front of me was so good and so HUGE, I made myself sick. (Its the next day in the morning as I write this and I&#39;m still feeling it). <br><br>In this case (as with most), less is more.

Been here several times. Everytime is great. The waiter I had last night was very knowledgeable with the menu and nice. The crusted chicken romano is one of my favorites. Make sure you prepare wait on the weekends or arrival early. It can get really packed.
Great salads, but the &#34;Walk Up Seating&#34; is a drag. Still, we stuff our pockets with crackers and energy bars, sign the list, and wait...  Yup, the food is that good!

I came here for my birthday lunch today. It&#39;s a Monday at 1pm, the place is not very full. Our waitress seemed kind of aloof honestly. She was very slow the entire time. Didn&#39;t catch her name, but she had curly light blonde hair. The food was good as always (thankfully). I wanted to order cheesecake to eat there, but I had somewhere to be! We ordered cheesecake to go instead. The next time she came to the table, she didn&#39;t have checks or the cheesecake. I have no clue why the service was so slow! Worst of all, after I was already home I realized she gave me the wrong cheesecake. I ordered Reese&#39;s, but got the Oreo one...and it wasn&#39;t amazing. I think I&#39;ll pick a different birthday place next year.

I feel like this place is overrated. Its always SUPER busy, but I guess that happens when its attached to the mall. So be prepared for a long wait.<br><br>The food is decent, but expensive. They do dish out large portions, though. They have a rather large menu, and have a little bit of something for everyone.<br><br>The cheesecake is pretty good, I will admit. I don&#39;t really want to go just for cheesecake, even if they do have a take-out section for cheesecake.

I wasn&#39;t happy with my meal because the tenders were dry, so i&#39;m assuming they were probably over cooked and they were bland too. When my server came out to ask how my food was, I told her just that. Also, because I didn&#39;t like them, I said I didn&#39;t want them. She took them away without even offering for me to get something else in place of it and I was still charged. I&#39;m only giving this a 2 instead of a 1 because the fries were good and so was the cheesecake.

If there&#39;s a quarter star, I&#39;ll give it to them!! I was third to the last on queue standing for a good 20 mins total and all the orders and the people behind me who ordered were gone, the guy in the register (Alec B--on the receipt) noticed me and asked &#34;What fudge cake are you getting?? What cheesecake??&#34;...what the hell?!? He needs to get customer service classes because he didnt even apologize!!

Food took hours to come and my pot stickers were disappointing at best. Had to live off the bread. The cheesecake tasted good tho (banana). I hated the decor because the booths made a me 4&#39;8&#34; feel very claustrophobic and the small size of the seats meant my butt was halfway parked on the person I was sitting next to, who is a petite little self like me.

Stopped in here just last night just to pick up dessert. I had the peanut butter reese cheesecake. Let&#39;s just say if you like cheesecake and you like reese peanut butter I say this is truly a hit. It was not too busy so I was in and out.

The menu is huge. I would recommend looking at it at home and make your mind in any way, otherwise you might be stuck with two menu brochures (light menu and the regular fares). Be prepared to get a monster of a meal, one plate can feed a person for two days...Their portions are huge. Drinks are delightful, service is efficient and quick. Save room for dessert! Their cheesecakes are a must (they offer a carry-out too, where you can buy their cheesecakes by the slice or the whole cake). What a variety!!! Their coffee is good...<br><br>Date night-share two appetizers and drinks, can easily suffice as a meal...Parking is easy (mall garage or valet). Location is excellent. If you go on Friday-weekend nights, be prepared to wait...I don&#39;t think they take any reservations, but one can always order a drink at the bar and hang around, waiting, people-watching...Place is always hopping. I guess we&#39;ve been there about ten times so far and never were disappointed. My favorites so far (besides the cheesecake) are their calamari appetizer, mojitos, and GLAMBURGERS!!!! Americana burger beats Five Guys, enough said...Try it! Their french fries are superb, even the day after, place them in the hot (400 degrees) oven for 5 minutes and they come out nice and crispy! Seriously...This is the place to go (if you don&#39;t mind the noise, noise is a minus, but oh well, the place is popular!).

Food was excellent and portion sizes were very large and filling. We went in for Saturday Sunday brunch (10-2pm) and my friend got Green Chilaquiles with Carnitas and Egg and I got the Fried Chicken and Waffles Benedict. Chicken was perfect, moist on the inside and with tasty batter on the outside, and went with the waffles well. My friend really liked the Chilaquiles. Server seemed rushed even though the restaurant was less than half full, but was quick to get anything forgotten like side of syrup or drinks. <br>The food was so satisfying neither of us could fit dessert at the end, but the cheesecake there is amazing, so we ordered two slices to go for when we weren&#39;t as stuffed. I was disappointed in how bland the white chocolate peppermint bark cheesecake was, didn&#39;t taste like much besides a lot of crunchy minty bits where&#39;s the cheesecake? but the reason I tried a new flavor is because I love so many of TCF&#39;s flavors! I admit I usually just go for cheesecake and not a whole meal, and then the Lemon Raspberry Cream or Chocolate Mousse cheesecakes are wonderful favorites. I took a chance on the Vanilla Bean cheesecake (too many places think vanilla means tasteless) and really enjoyed it, definite vanilla flavor and the crust, mousse, and cheesecake were all distinct and great together.

My wife and I went here with a gift card. We had eaten the cheesecake before but never ate dinner here. We were pleasantly surprised! Although most options are on the expensive side, it was hard for me to pick between all of the great offerings. I settled on the bang bang (thai style) chicken and shrimp. Very delicious... I saved room for a Kahlua cheesecake slice which was scrumptious. My wife had a very good French onion soup and Nutella cheesecake slice.<br><br>I&#39;d say we waited a bit long between waitress visits, and were seated a bit too close to other customers (there was a couple right next to us, cafeteria style)!. The free bread should just be eliminated as it was not wanted (we were destined to overeat either way) and frankly not too great. Regardless, I would highly recommend the restaurant for its great menu and classy (but not unwelcoming) atmosphere.

First time I have been to this location and I must say the apps were not very impressive. The cheesacake was good. <br><br>This review is mainly for our amazing server, Dave. He was great!!! We have a party of 6 who was very slow and needy, but he was so nice and accomidating! He had a great sense of humor and very personable. By far one of the best servers I have ever had.

I&#39;m not a huge fan of the Towson area, as I find it to be overly crowded and expensive. Lately though, I find myself being introduced to the area in a new light... local boys will do that to ya.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory: decent prices, very LARGE menu (probably 5 normal pages of menu items), inviting atmosphere, good food. The prices may seem expensive at first glance, but the portions you are given are about (2) servings of food and will last you for about two meals. And of course, the dessert: let&#39;s just say I&#39;ve had pretty phenomenal cheesecake in New York but Cheesecake Factory is up to par and I&#39;m no longer required to drive all the way to New York for a slice of heaven. Not to mention you can get any amazing flavor of cheesecake that you want; I personally lean more towards anything and everything with Peanut Butter. <br><br>For those who are tuned to my Nautilus Diner review and are awaiting the next chapter of my personal &#34;Rom-Com&#34;.. date #3 was tasteful and supposedly I&#39;m &#34;honest to a fault&#34;, go figure :)
I am dropping a star as the food and service just isn&#39;t impressive. Albeit, I still love the red velvet cheesecake.

First off, the wait was a long line and we had to wait forever and there was not even that many people there. Second, when our pager when off we had to wait another 10 minutes to be seated. When we were seated the hostess took us to a table and it was not ready then she just disappeared and left us without a table in the middle of the restaurant. Fourth, she was very rude. Fifth, the service was terrible and the food was not what it used to be. Don&#39;t eat here. Go to another cheesecake factory that runs more efficiently.

Brought out my Burger and said fries will be right out 15mn later my burgers gone and they bring out my fries I told them to just keep them . Still got charged full price had 3 people with me 100 tab and no type of sorry or anything. I will never eat at this location again .

The food here is very good.  That being said, it is overpriced, very dimly lit (felt like I was eating in a cave) and overcrowded.  The seating is horrible, you&#39;re basically touching elbows with whoever is seated at the table next to you.  In my opinion you&#39;d have a much better time calling in your order and eating this good food at home.

SO bad for you, yet I think almost every time that I return to towson I go here at some point. <br>Of coarse I think the majority of the people know about the factories food, but I have to state my opinion anyways. <br>The menu is quite extensive, pages and pages of food that ranges from salads, to sandwiches to full on courses.  <br>I always seem to opt for a sandwich , buffalo chicken~ Thats the way to go  :] <br>I used to get cheesecake when I went .. but that has become at thing of the past..<br>Its just eye candy for me now.

Great food. Good Gluten free menu. Management and wait staff should be retrained. Food took too long to get out. Messed up my daughters GF meal. The bread we were supposed to get at beginning came towards the end of our meal. The side dish of broccoli (very tasty) came soon after. Then it took 15 minutes for slice of cheesecake, which had some paper in it. We got it comped but still. <br>I watched the manager talk to bar staff rather than walk around and see if people needed anything or were ok. He sets the tone for the poor service.

Fantastic place to eat, whether it be for casual lunch or dinner date.  The semi-casual, semi-formal ambiance allows you to chill out and enjoy some of the best cuisine in Towson, MD. I highly recommend this place.

There is everything to love when you step inside The Cheesecake Factory! Something might mentally be wrong if you feel otherwise. I would  suggest to not go on weekends unless you don&#39;t mind the wait like 30 mins plus. The decor is classy yet comfortable and casual. Everything on the menu is made fresh. The prices are a little high about $8-10 for an appetizer and an entree would range $20 or so. The portions equal what we pay, big portions. The hot wings are huge meaty and fabulous. Some of my friends go JUST for the wings!<br><br>       I get the Jamaican shrimp with rice, beans, plantains and mango <br>salsa. That runs about $20 and is well worth it, spicy and sweet. My friend got the steak and fries. They enjoyed it, tender juicy and a big portion of great tasting fries. You can order a side of mac &amp; cheese that&#39;ll cost about $4.95 but the portions of it you&#39;ll definately have some for a doggybag. I&#39;ve only bought 2 of their cheesecakes but all the flavors I have tried are phenomenal. <br><br> Honestly, everyone that I introduce to The Cheesecake Factory loves it <br>and become lifetime fans.

I&#39;ve been to this CF the most, so I have more to base my star level on. I&#39;ve said it before, if it was based just on cheesecake, it would be a 5.<br><br>But the wait at this sucker is almost ALWAYS more than an hour. I&#39;d say about 3 out of the around 10 I&#39;ve been here the wait has been minimal. I do wish they had a call-ahead wait list, because people-watching in Towson Town Center is fun for about 4 minutes, then it gets gross. It is miserable waiting for this bitch.<br><br>Moving on, a plus of this CF is it seems big... more booths. But I don&#39;t really think there are more booths, as I&#39;ve been seated in those dumb long tables where you&#39;re nearly elbowing the people next to you several times. <br><br>My food has been generally okay, but a few times things have been lukewarm instead of hot, and that is not something I feel comfortable complaining about. <br><br>The service has always been fine here. Except the hostesses/hosts. They seem like they have a &#39;tude, when pa-lease, they should be the ones trying to win us back after we&#39;ve waited 90 minutes to be seated. <br><br>Anyways, the cheesecake... oh, oh, the cheesecake. *dies*
Love the Thai Lettuce Wraps!  Cheesecake a bit pricey but delicious. Great service. Will definitely come back. Disappointed the appetizer pretzel crusted chicken skewers have been discontinued.

Food was great but carry out service was terrible. Called to place and order and they tried to charge me extra for a dinner item when I specifically requested the lunch special (difference of 8$). Received the bag and all the lids immediately came loose spilling the sauce. Again the food was delicious but I would recommend going in to dine and staying away from the carry out service if possible.
It was just ok. The food was ok. The wait staff was ok. My brother pick this place and since it was his day we had to oblige. The one at the Harbor is way better in my opinion.

Usually I like CCF ! I love their chicken samosas and selection of wines. <br>But this location is not up to the standards of CCF. <br>I think the margherita pizza I tasted here is so far the worst margherita ! I mean, there is Olive Garden which competes but still, this location is pretty awful too..
Nice place, never had a bad meal there.  Service has always been friendly and very good.  A little pricey but recommended.

This review is strictly for the best waitress ever, Julie.  She is super cute and bubbly. Accommodates to your every need. I always ask if she&#39;s working every time I visit the Cheesecake Factory and you should too! :)

The Cheesecake Factory has a large menu, so anyone could find something that they like. They also have a lot of great drinks! However, it is always busy here, so making reservations would be a good idea
Had lunch with friends and the food was ok but the booth was dirty.  The server was good but slow

I don&#39;t have a Cheesecake Factory where I live, so if I can get to one when I&#39;m out of town, I will. I don&#39;t love the place, but they&#39;re not awful. The problem for me is their menu is so huge, I&#39;ve yet to find anything I absolutely love. However, I think I finally found my meal there.<br><br>First, the wait was surprisingly short. I&#39;m used to having to wait at least half an hour. We had a wait but it wasn&#39;t too bad. The service was good too, as it always is. They must put a big emphasis on service there because I&#39;ve never had a bad experience in regards to that.<br><br>Then, the food. I got the meat loaf which was amazing. I was tossing up whether to get the sandwich or the meal. I got the meal, but I asked for a side of the tomato bacon jam because I thought it sounded interesting (it comes on the meat loaf sandwich). It was all so good, including the jam. The brown gravy on the meat loaf is good too but the jam is something different. You can get meat loaf with brown gravy anywhere. It comes with mashed potatoes and corn succotash, and boy was that succotash good.<br><br>The portions are ginormous, so if you&#39;ve never been to one, be very hungry when you go or be prepared to either split your meal with someone or take leftovers with you.

Went there for the first time and I would definitely go back.  The food was a little bit more pricey than I expected, but it was worth it.  I had a S&#39;mores Cheesecake, which was delicious, but really rich.  I wouldn&#39;t recommend any cheesecake with chocolate in it, because you probably won&#39;t be able to eat all of it.  Looking forward to my next trip there.

I ate at this location many times over an unexpected trip to MD.  We always had great service and the food was predictably good. We had everything from salads (the kale, greek, farro and beet, chopped veggie) to apps (tex mex egg rolls, quesidillas, fried mozzarella, flat breads), club sandwiches, chicken marsala, and of course, cheesecake. <br>It&#39;s a busy location, so prepare to wait if you go during peak hours.  Go to the bar and try the Georgia Peach, it&#39;s delicious!

I don&#39;t want to write a lot on here because The Cheesecake Factory is the Cheesecake Factory.  How can you not love a place that has Cheesecake?<br><br>The only thing with this though is I didn&#39;t like the aftertaste of our burger sliders (kind of tasted gross).  But their Avocado Egg Rolls were to die for.  And their drinks were delicious!<br><br>If I were you (a guy taking a girl on a date), just get 1-2 appetizers with a drink, then of course get some cheesecake!  The portions here are just TOO BIG to get an entree AND cheesecake.

Sucks bigtime.<br>What ever my husband odered they didn&#39;t have...what kind of resturant first have anything....<br><br>Real racists..took for ever to acknowledge us..then it took a while to take the order...took forever to come <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fback.to&amp;s=443d2e89ea806cd7a3c868c063eac7358881c8db25ba91c7bc38c94679bd5134" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">back.to</a> say they dint have it....and it repeated 4times.<br>My food was burnt !!<br>Plenty of resturants in the area to go too...dint have to come here and be treated like this...

Yes, it&#39;s a chain; yes, it&#39;s very popular, noisy and crowded; but yes, it is always good! i have NEVER been disappointed with my food at this fun restaurant. The prices are very reasonable, the portions pretty large and the quality, always great. The service has been lacking on one occasion, but that was the exception and i won&#39;t let that ruin my opinion of this fine chain restaurant. I usually get one of the very imaginative chicken dishes or a steak combo platter. You can&#39;t go wrong with one of their BIG SALADS either. I don&#39;t know how they ever sell any cheesecake here as I&#39;m always too full to do anything except order a slice to go. But on that subject, I just love the Mango Key Lime Cheesecake and the Dulce de Leche...absolutely delish!!!
On your next visit, make sure you give the Imperial Chicken and Shrimp some attention. In just a few words... Yum!

I didn&#39;t even get a chance to try their food b/c they would not take my reservation! <br><br> I had a party of 11 plus 2 children and wanted to make a reservation for a Thursday night at 7pm.  I didn&#39;t think I would have a problem since I was calling a week ahead of time.  <br><br>They said they only took reservations from 4-6pm, how ridiculous is that.  <br>We didn&#39;t want to wait when we got there so that&#39;s why I was calling wayyyy ahead of time.<br><br>This restaurant just lost the business of a whole family.

My husband and I had our date night here. Even though it was a weekday, the place was packed. After just a couple of minutes wait, we were seated.<br><br> I sincerely wish they didn&#39;t put the tables so close to each other. The adjacent  table was only a couple of inches away that it felt like we are practically one whole table. The size zero waitress didn&#39;t have any place to stand between the tables to take our order. And I could literally hear the the neighbours stomach growling!! lol..<br><br>Appetisers-<br>1. Sweet potato fries with the mustard dip was absolutely fantastic. Crispy,crunchy, sweet fries with a little bit of salt sprinkled on top !!!!! <br>2. Crispy  taquitos was ok-ok.. Nothing spectacular..<br><br>Entre-<br>1. My husband&#39;s order of Jambalaya pasta with chicken and shrimp was nice and full of flavour. You&#39;ll like it if you like spicy stuff.. They even put a good amount of shrimp and chicken it it. So that definitely is something we would definitely order again. <br>2. My Garlic noodle with shrimp was FLAVOURLESS, kind of SHRIMPLESS too.. The only thing good about the dish was the freshly grated cheese they put on top!! I asked the waitress about the dish having only a few shrimp, she told me that  they put only 4 per portion, which was exactly what i got. <br><br>We definitely would go again, but ask for a booth first!!

I was out on a date tonight at the cheesecake factory. <br>Not by first choice mind you, this was a geographic decision.But I have always enjoyed my CF visits.<br><br>The decor at this Cheesecake factory is Egyptian themed and looks great, high ceilings marble,hard wood, very nice.<br>The food and service were good as well. But just good. Not quite as nice as the face she puts forth.<br><br>We started with fried calamari, it was fresh and tasty, a nice portion. <br><br>For dinner my date had the Fish n Chips and I did the Cajun Jambalaya pasta.<br>4 large battered pieces of hand battered fish. I tasted some, OK, not bad. Lots of batter though.<br><br>My Jambalaya was decent, medium sized shrimp, chicken, onions peppers and tomatoes in a spicy sauce over a bed of linguine. Not incredible just reliable good food.<br><br>For desert I had the strawberry shortcake with fresh strawberries,  this is where CF shines...good stuff.It was huge I couldn&#39;t finish it. My date had the peanut butter something cheesecake, she said it was good. I didn&#39;t taste it, I&#39;m not a cheesecake fan.<br><br>Our server was a friendly young man, kinda funny how he asked how something looked every time he placed a dish down, had me laughing.<br><br>Check came to 73 bucks  for two minus tip..I guess someone&#39;s gotta pay for the marble and 30 foot ceilings..<br><br>All in all a good experience for a chain.<br><br>Nice digs Cheesecake factory, but I wish you were as delicious as you look.<br><br>One thumb up for the cheesecake factory.

Large portions, decent if predictable food.   But the tables are so damn close together it&#39;s like you&#39;re eating family style at an Amish place.  Ridiculous.   You&#39;re better off for &#34;privacy&#34; at the bar. .... although if you&#39;re unlucky enough to get the bartender we had, she&#39;ll completely ignore you in favor of trying to impress the suits who (she assumes) will tip better.   Someone needs to explain to her about self-fulfilling behavior.  Idiot.<br><br>Next trip to Towsontowne, I&#39;ll stick to the food court.
Standard Cheesecake Factory meal. Was pretty good as far as chain restaurants are concerned.  Wait staff was attentive.
Never trust a &#34;restaurant&#34; that can&#39;t execute a simple dish that can be made at home with the same half assed effort. I could have saved my $20 and had leftovers...
An extremely long wait for an appetizer on a Thursday nite. Not happy. Need to improve on service. Food was okay but not worth the wait of 30 minutes.

My sister took me to lunch here last week. The service was outstanding! The decor is beautiful. The Sheppards pie tastes homemade and delish. I had apple crumb cheesecake I loved every bite. Can&#39;t. Wait to take my husband soon. Excellent lunch. For my first visit I was really impressed. Everything was amazing!

It&#39;s good . . . it&#39;s a chain . . . it&#39;s way too long of a wait on the weekends.  <br>Went for lunch today and the smaller portions are great.  Navajo chicken sandwich was fabulous.  Good eats . . .but it&#39;s a chain.

It&#39;s a chain. What can I possibly review about a chain? Portions are large but the prices aren&#39;t low. Cheesecake is good. Wait is too long and it&#39;s way too hyped up. Spend your money on a local restaurant and you will have a better night.

I must say, when you know almost everyone who works here your dining experience is that much better.<br><br>I got the alfredo for lunch, and it was a good portion. Very good, too. My strawberry cheesecake was fantastic. It was like having sex in my mouth. That&#39;s how amazing it was. <br><br>Pricey, but you get what you pay for.

Ate many Cheesecake Factory across the country and one in Towson Town Center is the first cheesecake that was an epic fail. From the moment waking in the hostess doesn&#39;t greet with a smile, but with the snootiest attitude! You come out to eat expecting a great experience but with this older lady in the front, don&#39;t expect it! Food was salty and bland the pasta was over cooked. Don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever come back!

There&#39;s nothing to hate about the Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s just overwhelming sometimes because the menu is sooo huge, and the place is even bigger. You can&#39;t make reservations for small groups (not sure of the number) so keep that in mind when you plan to go. I generally only go when I get a gift card. <br><br>That being said, they have this crab wonton appetizer that is awesome and highly recommended! Also, they have a frozen drink which is called the georgia peach I THINK and it&#39;s worth a try as well!

Food pretty good. Service at the bar is usually not good. Three bartenders and not one showed a bit of personality and cared that we were dining with them. They did not give or offer us bread but they offered the people around us. My wine glass was filthy and sticky. Servers and bartenders work for their tips and these bartenders clearly didn&#39;t care.

going out of my way to avoid chains for years, I suppose I missed a potential gem. As most everyone knows virtually every restaraunt in Towson has closed, The only remaining is Cafe Troia. All that is left is nearly a dozen crappy sushi places and bars.<br><br>Not wanting to head to Lutherville, we decided &#34;why not&#34; never been there.<br>well, everything we ordered was either good to excellent. <br>Now this is not fine dining, but I can tell you the wines were serviceable, the food was fresh and well-made and of generous proportion. The servings, as one would expect in a chain, were huge and the service was prompt and courteous.

The food was pretty good.  I ordered the Steak Diane and the first medallion I bit into wasn&#39;t as warm as it could have been.  The other pieces were a bit warmer.  It was cooked correctly as ordered (med-rare).  Our waiter seemed to have other things that were more important, however I didn&#39;t notice where his other tables were.  His inattentiveness caused us to leave and return to our hotel for a few more drinks.  Had he been more attentive, we would have stayed for another drink.  And the kicker: he came by and picked up the check before we had left.  Major rule in waiting tables...never pick up the check while the customer is still there.  Glad I tipped him appropriately.  Perhaps I anticipated that?<br><br>Bottom line: it was good for a semi-late dinner after being on the road and traveling, but I will try another restaurant next time I am in the area.
Best Cheesecake Factory in town. Clean, good service, and the food is prepared the way it is supposed to be.

I went here for the second time this past weekend. I had been telling my best friend about it ever since I had gone for my birthday and we finally decided to go.<br><br>Upon arrival we were seated right away. It was a tiny both, but since it was just two of us, it was okay. Our waiter Paul was awesome. I swear he&#39;s a mind reader of some sorts since he knew exactly what my friend was going to order to drink and the type of cheesecake she was going to get later. Or he&#39;s just a really good guesser. But still, he was hilarious and was a fantastic waiter.<br><br>The food was amazing! My only complaint is that I wish my salad had more chicken in it. You give someone a huge salad and just a few small bits of chicken? Doesn&#39;t add up. But still, I&#39;m sure we&#39;ll be going back and I&#39;m sure it will be just as good!

We walked in around 8pm on a Thursday night and we immediately seated.  Our waiter attended to us quickly and was very helpful and friendly.  We ordered the shrimp bistro pasta and the double bbq bacon cheeseburger.  The food was so good we each cleared off our plate. The portions are huge! Unfortunately they dont serve smaller portions for dinner, only lunch before 5pm. One of the better experiences I&#39;ve had at a cheesecake factory restaurant.

I love the Cheesecake Factory and this location did not disappoint.  We were seated right away in a nice corner booth--away from the noise.  Our waitress was very nice and accommodating.  Everything we ordered was from the Skinnylicious menu and although the dishes had less calories, they were not lacking in taste or size.  I particularly enjoyed the Skinnylicious lettuce wraps and the Asian Chicken Salad.  The low cal Sangria was also delicious.  Overall, I really enjoyed my meal here.

An acquaintance used to say the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s portions offended him.  They do serve you a huge amount of food, and from a very extensive menu; ranges from diner to comfort to Asian-accented.  Our usual go-tos are the Avocado Eggrolls (deep fried and stuffed full with avocado chunks, sundried tomato, red onion, cilantro, with a great spicy, sweet-tangy tamarind-cashew dipping sauce) and the Thai Lettuce Wraps (chicken, bean sprouts, variety of dipping sauces, veg garnishes; crisp and fresh).  One could make a meal of just an app.  <br>  <br>Really, though, can&#39;t come to a place called the CHEESECAKE Factory and not have the cheesecake.   Fave fun flavors:  Banana, Oreo, Chocolate Mousse, Key Lime, Pumpkin, could go on and on.  Have found the fruit flavors to be like fruit (not artificial) and the chocolate ones very decadent. Haven&#39;t tried a bad one yet (but then again, it is cheesecake, can&#39;t really go wrong).<br>  <br>The Dulaney location sees its fair share of tired mall goers and packs of roving teenagers.  The wait can be a little long, hostesses a  little on the underage side and flaky, and the waitstaff just about the same.  Lighting is somewhat dim, and the space is tight.

Waiter was bad, very slow. Took a good 20-30 minutes for the food to arrive. Gave her my card to pay, didn&#39;t come back for a good 5 minutes. Finished our food, waited about 10 minutes for her to actually get our bill. Wouldn&#39;t recommend.

After calling ahead to reserve a table for a large group of co-workers for our holiday lunch - we were told on arrival that they could not find our booking and had filled all the large tables with walk-ins. They then disputed we had called at all. They offered to split us between booths and told us that it was our fault we had no confirmation number. Had I known they would provide one by phone or that I should have asked for one, things might have been different. <br><br>Service here was appalling and we gave up. Across the way is a better steakhouse where I would recommend diners considering eating here should rather go.

Damn right, I&#39;m a fan of the Cheesecake Factory and the oversized portions.  I&#39;m a fan of the amazing layout and dimly-lit atmosphere.  I&#39;m a fan of the customer service provided by the hostess and the waiters/waitresses.  Finally, I&#39;m a fan of those irresistible cheesecakes that I can&#39;t seem to eat at the restaurant once I eat my large dinner.<br><br>What I am not a fan of is the long wait times.  Unfortunately, Cheesecake Factory does not take reservations, so it&#39;s a first come first serve type of deal.  You know what that means: you got to bum rush a couple of people to get in front of the line.  Oops...I meant to say get there early.  The wait is definitely worth it.<br><br>I have gotten the Steak Diane, which is pretty good.  I have also gotten the Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Madeira combination.  It was my first time getting Chicken Madeira, and I&#39;ll say it was OK.  The Shrimp Scampi definitely hit the spot though.<br><br>Note:  There is valet parking offered by the Cheesecake Factory for only $5.  However, it tends to fill up pretty quickly.  There is also Curbside dining, something similar to Applebee&#39;s and other restaurants that offer this service.<br><br>I haven&#39;t been at the bar yet, but I will surely be making my way here very soon.  My optimal equation:  <br><br>Bud Light (or any alcoholic beverage) + cheesecake = match made in heaven.

Ugh. I am not strongly anti-chain, but this place really suffers from the bland mediocrity that anti-chain people complain about. &#34;Factory&#34; is right!<br><br>Every time I&#39;ve gone, there&#39;s been an enormous wait. The tables are uncomfortably close together; I don&#39;t know how the poor servers manage to get around. With all the people they cram in there, it gets really loud. I&#39;ve been there 3-4 times and never had an appetizer or entree that was worth the price. Despite all the oil and salt the kitchen adds, the food lacks distinct flavor and character.<br><br>Their mixed drinks are pretty good, though many are syrupy-sweet. The tall, fluffy pieces of cheesecake are decadent, but I don&#39;t like waiting through a sub-par meal to get to it. I prefer stopping here after I&#39;ve been shopping at the mall and buying a to-go slice of cheesecake to bring home and eat in comfort.

It has been about ten years since I had been to the Cheesecake Factory downtown.  My recollection was that the cheesecake was superb, the portions were absurdly large and the non-dessert food was poor.  Today, my family decided to try the new Towson location for lunch.<br><br>We arrived at 12:15 and were told that the wait would be about 20 minutes.  This proved to be accurate.  Once we were seated we ordered our beverages including specifying that we wanted lemon with the iced teas.  The drinks were delivered, but no lemons.  We asked for lemons two more times before they were delivered.  Among our orders, a caesar salad was requested with the dressing on the side.  It came drowned in dressing.  This was bad enough, but furthermore, the caesar dressing was terrible as these things go.  The herb-crusted salmon on another salad was cold, undercooked and smothered with wet herbs (i.e. not &#34;crusted&#34; in any way).  A Pizzete appetizer was good, the four cheese pasta was fine and some chicken tenders were OK too.  The fries had been salted so heavily that they were barely edible.   <br><br>As I feared, we had more food left over than we had been able to consume.  Since the salads had been drowned in dressing, they were not salvageable.  This single location must throw out enough food in a month to feed a small country.  I am not a religious person, but I found myself thinking that the waste was positively sinful.<br><br>We did order a slice of Oreo cheesecake to go.  I ate some of it tonight, and it was superb.<br><br>To sum up, Cheesecake Factory has not changed at all in ten years.  My recommendation is to eat your meal next door at P.F. Chang&#39;s and then buy some Cheesecake to go and eat it when you get home for dessert.

Lunch at the Cheesecake Factory in the Towson location proved to be delightful. Usually chain restaurants are not my favorites but this one changed my mind so much I ordered a bunch of gift cards so i could return another time. The menu is extensive and requires a good pair of reading glasses for those who have problems viewing lots of type on a page. I was given a book with many pages of food selections as well as a brochure with a number of skinnyliscious selections. Nothing tastes better than a nice fresh cold salad on a hot June day so I ordered the French garden salad with grilled chicken (from the skinny menu) and a glass of cold iced tea. In about 15 minutes my food came out as I was finishing reading an article about how couples criticize each other. The server presented me with a huge beautiful salad with field greens, beets (there could have been a few more) candied pecans, goat cheese and perfectly grilled sliced chicken. This was  a salad masterpiece created by the staff in the Cheesecake Factory kitchen. I ate the whole thing with a very nice tangy sweet balsamic vinaigrette dressing that I drizzled on it. There was a bit too much purple cabbage but I pulled it out so i could taste the other greens. The chicken was perfectly  grilled without grease and was fork tender.<br><br>I have no criticism of this lunch. The service was perfect, the iced tea was real and the salad was delish. The bill was not cheap for sure but somehow I did not mind paying for good food and such a nice experience. I can&#39;t wait to receive my gift cards so I can return in the near future. Bon appetit as Julia Childs would have said.<br><br>I checked out the restroom and noted that the facility was clean and well stocked. Lastly, the place was busy for a Tuesday but the noise level was fine and there was no strange annoying music playing in the restaurant to disturb people who wanted to chat over lunch.

I have been to many Cheesecake Factory restaurants across the U.S., but went to this one for the first time on New Year&#39;s Day.  <br><br>It seems that the major knock on this location is the sub-par service.  I didn&#39;t encounter that issue when I was there, although the place may have been less popular due to the holiday.<br><br>The food was good - I shared the everything pizza with my wife and we left feeling full and happy.  I find the portions generous and the prices reasonable.  There also is a great variety and the food is consistently good.<br><br>If there were a Cheesecake Factory closer to my home, I would probably go more - that is how much I like the chain!

We find it very crowded and loud. Some of the seats are close together and dont seat where the wait staff heads for the kitchen. The food of course is good and staff are usually on par. We have been here many times and will again.
This is awesome food and great service.  Go.  Plain and simple

Ok so chain restaurants kind of give me a bad feeling. So many are poorly executed that I tend to streer clear of them. That being said I am almost always pleased with the cheesecake factory in Towson. I get the healthier side of the menu mostly Asian or Thai type dishes but I am always happy at the end of my meal. I got the pear martini which was both refreshing and just slightly sweet. I had a wonderful birthday dinner and our serve was spot on. So thank you cheesecake factory for finally being a chain that I will continue to go back too. The only bad thing I can think of is the menu is so large it takes me about 20 minutes to decide what I want. But since my family is almost always tardy for the party no biggie. My cocktail and some light browsing of the menu was nice this past Friday night.

This location is ALWAYS busy. I have never come here and had a wait time of less than 40 minutes. Here are some suggestions if you plan to come here: <br>A.) Don&#39;t come when you&#39;re really hungry--You may be driven to cannibalism while you&#39;re waiting for a table. <br>B.) Don&#39;t come here without reading material/smart phone gaming/portable movie player/folding chair--Since their &#34;table pagers&#34; that they give you will not get a signal beyond 10 feet of their doors, going for a walk around the mall as you wait 3 hours for a table is out of the question. You need to stay entertained somehow. What&#39;s the folding chair for? Oh, that&#39;s for your you to rest your aching feet. There is ONE (1) long bench that is there in the lobby waiting area (inside) and a couple benches beyond the doors of the mall entrance, and as you can imagine, they fill up quickly. This means, you&#39;ll be left with standing for the entire length of time until you get a table assignment which typically takes between 40mins to 1 hr 30 mins for a party of 2-4 people.<br>C.) DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU HAVE A PARTY LARGER THAN FOUR PEOPLE. We made the mistake of coming here with 6 of us one time, and we had a 2 hour wait. They wouldn&#39;t even give us a pager until the wait time was at the 1 hour mark, but after waiting 2 hours and 40 minutes, we decided to just hit up P.F. Changs right next door. <br><br>Trust me, the quality of service that you&#39;ll get isn&#39;t typically worth the stress of the long wait times. I&#39;ve been here a handfull of times, and each time I am asking myself it it really is worth it. Answer: NO. You&#39;re better off ordering the food to-go, and enjoying the meal in the comfort of your home...where there is NO WAIT TIME.

Never had a bad experience here, food is great and prices are reasonable. The waiting staff is always courteous and pleasant. Only down fall is I wish they would take reservations or at least do call a heads.

I have eaten at Cheesecake Factory probably 4 times and have never had a bad meal. The portions are huge. You will definitely have leftovers to bring home. So far, the menu item I liked best has been the Chicken Madeira. My husband had a teriyaki steak dish tonight and that tasted good, too. There are a lot of items to choose from. The cheesecake is delicious.     Most of the slices are big enough to share. My family usually orders two different kinds of slices and shares them. Be prepared to wait a long time to be seated. I have never had less than an hour wait here. Tonight the wait was 1 1/2 hours. You can roam the mall for a bit while waiting as long as you are back 1/2 hour before your estimated wait time given. They do not take reservations or do call ahead seating.

went here for my birthday with my boyfriend august 4th around 9p.m. got seated really quickly. .got seates by the kitchen (loud and rude conversation, trash being dragged next to our booth as the night went along) me and my bf are both chefa and RARELY go out to eat for that very reason. so when we do head out we expext excellent service KNOWING how the food industry runs.. the waitress (very low hair cut, female, heavyset, darkskin with glasses- didnt give a name so im describing her) was very rude. rushed us when ordering our drinks..didnt come back for our order until 15 minutes later...only refilled my bfs water and only filled my coke once. brought a basket of 2 peices of burnt bread to the table and never came back with more when we told her it was burnt. left us a square of butter in a dirty dish..tgen we don&#39;t see her for anoyher 20 or ao minutes when we pulled her up to take our order...waited another 30 gor our food. (alfredo and cajun pasta) the alfredo was good, bu you could tell the food has been sitting there for a while...my noodles were stuck together..while waiting for our food we conversate about the service and the tip..no later than 5 minutes after that she comes rushing past us yelling &#34;I KNOW I BETTER GET A TIP!! I TREAT MY CUSTOMERS DAMN GOOD, I SHOULDN&#39;T BE HEARING ANY COMPLAINING...&#34; going on and on to the too of her lungs..IN FRONT OF MANAGER&#39;S AND CUSTOMERS..cussing and yelling about a tip..she was ear hustling on our convo knowing she had been avoiding our booyh the whole night. it wasn&#39;t even busy! we then got our food and ahe came over with a nice/nasty attitude clearly you could tell ahe was trying to be smart so we asked for our check to leave...she comes back and asks &#34;oh, you aren&#39;t getting arent cheesecake?!&#34;  we replied.. no and she walked off to get the check..came back for the money and asked if we needed change.. told her rude ass NO nad got my birthday cheesecake from the bakery stand and she walked behind us the entire time...we chooae this CCF because its the best in baltimore...might have to find another spot now..

Great service tonight!  In town for business and wasn&#39;t really big on the Cheesecake Factory bc the menu is so large but - I was a team with the colleagues and actually- tonight&#39;s visit was quite pleasant! For a friday night- the wait was reasonable. The waiter was FAB! His name was Mike and he was stellar. Very accommodating and prompt. I got the Boston House Salad and added cranberry, avocado and grilled shrimp. Excellent. I must say. Everyone at the table had desert. The mango key lime cheese cake was great. I&#39;d go back definitely!

Was here yesterday. I was seated almost immediately, and it took a bit to get our bread, but that&#39;s okay. I ordered the Kobe Burger, and it was amazing. It took a while for the waiter to refill our drinks, but it was a pretty busy night. I got the Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake to go for dessert. It was great.

I think Cheesecake is a little overrated. The food is good, depending on what you get. But I&#39;ve never had anything that completely blew me out of the water. It&#39;s good, a little pricey but big portions. But they just need a few new menu items that really blow other restaurants out of the water. <br><br>But the Oreo cheesecake is a gift from heaven.

I have been to every cheesecake factory location in Virginia, DC and Maryland. Like many others have said its very nice in there. I have been there for dates, family and girls night out trips. This place is pretty amazing. My favorites are the Buffalo Blasts, Fried Mac n Cheese, Chicken Bellagio, and the flatbreads.<br><br> I personally don&#39;t care for the avocado rolls and the samosas are okay. Beware of the nachos, very greasy and it gets very repetitive eating it. The biggest problem with this restaurant is if you got past 9pm on a weekend.Service is very rushed and the managers have little patience with complaining customers.  Since its connected to the mall, it gets really crowded. And the cheesecake is obviously amazing. My personal favorite is the White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle.<br><br>Its a good place to go and the prices seem high but the portion are so big you&#39;ll probably have leftovers.

I went to this restaurant the other day with a group of co-workers for our holiday luncheon.  I have to say that it was a pretty positive experience, despite my general loathing of chain megaplex restaurants. <br><br>Three people in our party ordered appetizers to share with the rest of the table. One person ordered the BLT salad which to her shock and awe was a halved head of iceberg lettuce with mayonnaise, egg, bacon and tomato chunks spilling all over it like a volcano science fair project gone wrong.  We all sampled it and were unimpressed.  I thought it was a bad concept all around-messy and hard to eat.  The other appetizer was crab wontons.  Most people liked this, and while I thought it had a good initial &#34;crabby&#34; flavor, but didn&#39;t like the overly greasy after taste.  Another appetizer was the fried/stuffed artichoke hearts.  These were cheesy and delicious enough alone without the dipping sauce it came with.<br><br> For my lunch, I ordered the Cajun pasta which had shrimp, chicken and vegetables in a spicy sauce over tri-colored linguini. It was very delicious, assertively spicey, and of course an insane amount of food!   Many of the others in our party had the grilled salmon and found it very favorable.  Everyone brought home leftovers and desert.  I enjoyed the key-lime cheese cake, which was suitably tart but assuaged by the additional whipped cream.  <br><br>Our waitress was pleasant, attentive and quick with our many requests for additional napkins, straws, boxes, etc.  She definitely deserved more than the 15% automatic gratuity for large parties.  All staff there at lunch were pleasant and polite.  I will happily revisit in the future.

We dined here on Tuesday evening. We were greeted by the hostess and seated immediately. Our waitress acknowledged us immediately as well and took and delivered our drink order promptly.<br>We started with the popcorn shrimp, which arrived piping hot. A rather thick battered shrimp, which hid the taste of the shrimp.<br>Next we ordered the Ahi Tuna and a Cobb Salad. The cobb salad was their modern interpretation.
